Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: NJBeenThere
Reviews.Content: I specifically requested a room in the annex across the street at the back of the lobby as recommended by another reviewer. The room was quite large and included a kitchenette as well as a private outdoor patio. The breakfast was enjoyable and the front desk staff was very accomodating to our requests. Although we were only there one night, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Made Me Want To Go Back Home”
Reviews.Author: Josi_the_Great
Reviews.Content: I was in Italy for a total of 10 days staying at 4 hotels. This was my last city and last hotel on the trip. My friend and I heard great things about Venice and we were very excited about our stay in Venice. This was the worst hotel out of all the hotels we stayed in Italy. Our room was sizable, but it was extremely hot. The AC did not work and opening the window wasn't going to work due to all the cigarette smoke coming in from the outside. The staff was not friendly and didn't believe we stayed there because we looked very young. The food for breakfast was terrible. The fruit was warm and unsatisfying and after all the money of booking the hotel they charge you extra for eggs and bacon. The internet was not free and very very expensive charging 3 euros for 15 mins. I would strongly suggest going to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Willing to work with us”
Reviews.Author: alana m
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel was a bit strange. We were about to be taken to a room and the concierge said something in Italian about the room being "open." After sitting for about 10 minutes, we were taken to a clean, pretty room. We like it, but upon returning to it in the evening, discovered the street outside seemed to be a local "hang out" place. We talked to the front desk person, who first told us he could not do anything, and the second time (after the first group left and a second group came) we got upgraded to a suite, which was fabulous - Candela Suite or something like that. I also thought the continental breakfast was very nice. Overall, we had a positive experience! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: golfpro44
Reviews.Content: Its one of those hotels you'll never regret spending your dough on Very helpful staff and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with amazing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead30
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend that anyone wishing to stay at this hotel request a room on the top floor of the building, The beams and character is incredible, There is a serene and peaceful view from the window and the sound of the local church bells in the distance, I stayed here with my partner on my 30th birthday and all of her requests for my arrival were met with great attention to detail and planning. A fantastic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break”
Reviews.Author: lilmissgiggly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and tidy. We found the room a little small but weren't planning to spend much time in it! The rooms were kept very clean and the hotel staff were extremely friendly especially the man that was on reception each evening (unfortunately I didn't get his name but he deserves some praise from his boss!) The map that they give you on arrival is also very useful, it had much more information on it than the map we bought to take with us. On the downside we were in room 305 which had the lift in it which could get a little noisy at times. The rooms on floor 2 had the breakfast room coming off them which I thought would be noisier which is why i didn't ask to move. Venice is lovely but involves a lot of walking (make sure you take trainers)! The water busses are great and quite cheap at â‚¬33 for a 3 day pass. We didn't find it as expensive as everyone else seems to have but were were happy eating pizza for lunch off the street which was only â‚¬2.50 for a large slice. Also it's worth remembering not to buy cans of pop from anywhere except the little coops as they are â‚¬0.60 in there and â‚¬3.50 everywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location for getting around”
Reviews.Author: scarmic3
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but in an ideal location to see sights. Breakfast basic and in a very small room which filled up quickly. Take comfy walking shoes to get around and plenty of money as the pound is not very strong against Euro and it is expensive to eat in and around venice

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mumanddad R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times in Venice and this was one of the best hotels, We were in the newly converted building just by the main hotel and had a lovely first floor room looking out onto the square. We booked online and got a good rate and the staff were helpful - if a little formal - when we wanted to change dates etc. Breakfast is not a big event in venice so dont be disappointed, they will make expressos etc if asked. Its a good central location for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: DANNSAND
Reviews.Content: Brief and to the point.. The staff was friendly. My room was wonderul. Large by American standards. Bathroom was large with a whirlpool tub. First floor view of the canal. The hotel appears to have been updated. Long Distance calls only by calling card. My brothers room (107) was a make shift closet next the the breakfast room. He had ear plugs. One thing about Venice, rooms come in all sizes and shapes. Hotel was in a great location... The first night you may need to leave a trail of bread crumbs to get your navigation in check as Venice streets twist and turn. I would love to stay again (just don't put me in the closet room #107)

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded?”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great except that the staff started off on the wrong foot with me. The people in the front desk were very courteous and professional but when I checked-in, they decided to upgrade me from a â€œConti Querini Comfortâ€� room to a â€œClassicâ€� room without letting me know. The classic room is actually 10 euros more per night but to me it was not worth it. The classic room (in the actual hotel) was spacious but had mold and it smelled pretty bad. I noticed that the room was not the one that I wanted, so I went to the desk to express my concern. Then, the manager told me that he decided to upgrade me. I asked him to show me my actual room so I can decide. Even though the Conti Querini rooms are located 100 yards away from the hotel in a different building, I would not trade them. The Conti Querini rooms are beautiful and recently renovated; they look much modern. Breakfast was excellent. All remote controls were out of batteries and there was no permanent staff to assist us at the Conti Querini so they came from the hotel after I called them. Location is great since it is easy to get from the St. Markâ€™s Basilica (very important in Venice since it is easy to get lost). Everything was great but the â€œupgradeâ€� left me a bad feeling about the professionalism of the staff. Just because of that, I might not stay at this hotel the next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ScottRo
Reviews.Content: Great location. Use the map in the hotel website to find how to get to hotel. We took a ferry from Marco Polo airport to San Zaccaria vaperetto stop which is the closest to the hotel. Easy walk with no stairs from there. We had a room on the fifth floor up a steep little staircase. Only three rooms on this floor, with view across to San Marco bell tower. There is a tiny lift that we used to get to the fourth floor, but walked the stairs each day to leave the hotel. Breakfast is good. Cereal, yoghurt, toast, bread rolls with meat and cheese and sweet rolls. Coffee and tea in plentiful supply. Hot breakfast is at an extra charge of euro 2.50. Breakfast is served on the second floor with some rooms leading straight into the breakfast set up. this might be a problem. There is a self service laundry a few streets behind the hotel. In Ruga Giuffa. This street runs off Campo Santa Maria Formosa. Easy to use and open from 6am to midnight. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: Ashley S
Reviews.Content: Like a few other posts, the hotel was somewhat hard to find - the street given in the directions does not match what is written on the walls (thank goodness for helpful locals!). The room we stayed in, I believe 502, was huge - outside sitting area, kitchen and full bathroom with tub. We had a bit of trouble with the heat and requested help in turning it up some as it was only 15 degrees C but the staff did not remedy the problem and we ended up just toughing it out. The included breakfast had an up charge to add to the selection, the trip to Murano was a joke. We were dropped off at one shop - given no direction and no real tour. We were stuck there for over an hour and a half and were discouraged from venturing out - we completely would have utilized the public transportation had we not been promised that the next boat would be there in ten minutes (other customers kept being put in front of us). The gondola ride we paid for online through the hotel was over priced by at least 30 euro as written in the room book and was not a private ride at all. The boat we were put on was filled to the max 6 people, and had 4 or 5 other boats with. My friend and I were ok with sharing, however there was an abundance of other cheaper/private rides throughout the area. If a honeymooning couple - do not expect privacy on board as the the two couples on board were not pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A venetian fairy tale!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: Venice has been my dream destination as far back as I can remember and this hotel was the perfect place to stay and create my venetian fairy tale!!! We had booked the Deluxe room in the Conti Querini, the room itself was HUGE which was a pleasant surprise as I had heard most rooms were very small in Europe especially Venice, the bathroom was beautiful, large and modern, but my favorite part of our stay was sitting in the window that opened out to a lovely quiet piazza, watching and listening to the gondoliers serenading their passengers with songs and xylophones down the canal that ran beside the hotel. The breakfast was good not a great deal of selection however we spent a month traveling and breakfast was not a strong point anywhere. The staff were both friendly and welcoming. The directions that were given to us to find the hotel were perfect!!! I had heard horror stories of people aimlessly wondering for hours trying to find their hotel in Venice, but on our confirmation the hotel sent through directions that were very clear and along with our map we received from the alilaguna ticket desk we were at the hotel in about 10 minutes from the San Zaccaria stop. All in all our stay was wonderful and I would certainly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not more than a three star”
Reviews.Author: BobM415
Reviews.Content: After booking 13 rooms for three nights nine months in advance and paying in full before arrival, I was greeted with oh by the way you owe 4 euros per night per person tax. This 'new' tax was implemented sometime in the summer but the hotel did not have the courtesy to notify me prior to our arrival on September 28th. A well run hotel would have taken into consideration the large amount of the bill and written it off. The amount of the tax came to an additional $372. Not a great way to start a three day visit. The location is fairly good once you figure out how to find it. Everything else including the staff was at best average.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location!”
Reviews.Author: cilla10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in sept 2011. The staff were always helpful, supplying directions,suggesting places to eat or translating! The hotel is ideally positioned for seeing the sights. Breakfast was plentiful. Our room was huge & very comfy. Venice is such a magical place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: igotmojo
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, at the hotel they put us in a different building. We paid for the Conti Querini Room, but apparently that just means "in the other building around the corner". they told me that what I'd thought was an upgrade was the baseline room. Not sure if it was a bait and switch or if other rooms were better. The room was tiny, and the only window was a porthole but the bed was comfortable which I've found to be a rarity in Italy 3-4 star properties. The bathroom was separated from room by an added glass wall. Walls were paper thin, we could hear all the neighbors moving around their rooms and could hear dishes clanking in the breakfast room in the morning even though it was on a different floor. The building was on a very quiet piazza though so there was no noise from outside and it was nice and dark in the room which is nice for sleeping in. The room was clean, and had a triangle tub, but it was a handheld shower, with no curtain, which can be a bit of a challenge if you aren't used to not being able to stand under the shower head. I definitely wouldn't call it a 4 star property, but

Reviews.Title: “'What a magical place'”
Reviews.Author: bones4dogs
Reviews.Content: Directions to the hotel were good, if you have a good map. After reading the reviews about the annex, we had are reservations as we were shown there. We had room 608 on the second floor, a lovely room overlooking the square and the canal at the back. We woke each day to the sound of the lovely bells and the singing gondoliers. The room was smaller than expected, but we had a large bed, which was very comfortable. The room was clean, the bathroom excellent & clean, built as part of the bedroom. You need to understand these buildings are not built as hotels and have been converted. The staff we found too be more than helpful as was room service. Breakfast was a good continental which we filled up on for the day. There was a charming roof terrace as well, although we did not have time to use it. The hotel is in a good location for all of Venice. We ate locally and spent the evenings soaking up the atmosphere in St. Marks square. This was our 2nd trip to this magical city, and I expect we shall return again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not Great....”
Reviews.Author: richierich1984
Reviews.Content: After searching for 45 minutes we finally arrived at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and showed us to our room. It was not the room we had paid for, as we booked a Conti Querini Room however there had been a flood and we were put up in a standard room. Unfortunately the room was right next to the breakfast room, meaning that at 5.30am we were woken up by the sound of the kitchen preparing for breakfast. The room was ok, nothing to shout about. Strange smell, but maybe that was due to the canals being smelly. Would go back at a push but would prefer to pay a bit more and get a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbells
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set over a canal of course and I had a very grand room at the top of the hotel. It was beautifully historically furnished and decorated and very spacious although I did hear that the same cannot be said for all the rooms. Mine was great though and very in keeping with the hotel era etc. Staff were very helpful, friendly and accommodating and all attractions were just a short walk away. This was my first time in Venice and it truly feels like a magical city - I must return again soon to fully explore and appreciate this city on water. I would stay at this hotel again and had no complaints myself

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitude ++”
Reviews.Author: Beaujae
Reviews.Content: I appreciate that Venice is a beautiful city - of tourist - and I'm sure the locals (the few who live in the city) flee the summer months. This being said you expect things to be a little more expensive than the rest of Italy. What you don't expect is to pay more for less. Our holiday took in Rome Florence and Venice and this was the most expensive and most disappointing hotel we stayed in. The decor of the room was very Italian it just looked tired. The Internet pictures were clearly taken some time ago and well lit. Our room was dark and looked directly onto a canal (not romantic - equivalent of a view of a back alley). The room was OK but not worth the money. The biggest problem with the hotel was the staff attitude. It was as if we were inconviencing their day. They were not helpful and when they were they gave us incorrect information. I understand this is an economy based on tourism and as such they need to charge high prices to survive. I don't mind paying more, but I do expect more if I'm paying more. I hope that sites like trip advisor will encourage hotels, tours and restaurants in tourist areas to pick up their game and start to offer service that is equivalent to what they expect tourists to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Four-star in nothing but the price”
Reviews.Author: cerv
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Palazzo Conti Querini, small palazzo located a few steps from the hotelâ€™s main building, so some details may not aply. Upon our arrival we were shifted to another hotel, due to some problem with broken water-pipe. That itself made us feeling rather uncomfortable, as the hotel they booked for us had the smallest room Iâ€™ve ever seen and the bed was barely wide enough for a single person. However, when we finally moved back to the Palazzo we found roomy and coseting-feeling room, with wide and comfortable bed and lovely plastered ceiling. And thatâ€˜s about it. The place was so poorly insulated we could easily hear our neighbours doing their morning-throning. The air-con kept switching itself on over the night every five minutes or so. When we called the reception we were told theyâ€™re aware of that and working on fixing the problem â€“ which they did by switching the air-con off centrally, so there was no way to cool down the room over the hot daytime the following day. The other thing that didnâ€™t work was TVâ€™s remote, its batteries being so weak you had to stand right in the front of the set. Bathroom was built on a wooden platform inside the room, so you could hear your room mate very clearly, not matter if she was having a shover or... Even worse, though, there were mirror walls everywhere in the bathroom. If thereâ€™s something I really, really donâ€™t need to see, itâ€™s detailed three-dimensional picture of myself doing a poo. Better to sit down and look straight on to the shover. Oh, and there was no way to secure the bathroomâ€™s door, which might be compromising in some situations. Breakfast was very basic for a four-star hotel. I actually remember some family-run B&Bs with wider selection and higher quality food on the breakfast table than in this supposedly luxurious hotel. And they charged â‚¬2.50 extra for eggs&bacon! If I really need to go on, how about not having any room service? In a **** hotel! Admittedly, the hotel is no worse than average by venetian standards â€“ but these are even poorer than in the rest of Italy. Apparently thatâ€˜s the price to pay for the privilegium of staying in that wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic Spot with a Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Samdra16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Venice for four nights on our recent honeymoon. We had chosen this location off the internet. Not knowing entirely what to expect, we were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at our room. The hotel is a little difficult to find, but once you're there, it's really worth the effort. Not far from St Mark's Square and with decent restaurants in the vicinity, it's a good spot to stay in Venice. Outside the busiest, touristy areas of Venice like the Grand Canal but not too far either. We stayed in one of the rooms in the Conti Querini. It had a view overlooking the courtyard and two narrow canals with charming, old overpasses. In the morning, you can hear bells chiming and gondoliers singing. It was the ideal spot for a honeymoon and we were very fortunate to get such an exceptional room.

Reviews.Title: “Located in a Labrynth, not easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: mahadania
Reviews.Content: A very average hotel, I have been in much better staffed, comfortable four star hotels. We were given a wrong impression on the internet, and misinformed by the desk staff and missed our train to Florence. Wouldn't stay in this hotel again, it was also located in a very end corner not so accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great room for a family of four.”
Reviews.Author: OnOurWay_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room at this hotel and felt it was plenty of room for a family of four. It was a very quaint hotel and the service was standard. The location, however, couldn't have been better. We were between St. Marc's Square and Rialto bridge. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to argue for a better room”
Reviews.Author: CinCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a weekend getaway to Venice. We chose the hotel because of the excellent rate they offered at the time, but having read some reviews online before going, were cautious about room assignment. I am glad we had done some research, because, when we arrived, sure enough, we were told that we would be staying not in the main hotel, but in an 'annex' several minutes walk away. Our room in the annex was dirty (walls needed washing) and appeared unfinished (wires coming out of the walls). We requested a different room, and, to the hotel's credit, they were willing to move us to the main hotel. Our new room was less then ideal also (being located directly outside of the hotel dining room and kitchen) but was apparently the only other room available. We could hear staff socializing in the kitchen, and woke up to other guests eating their breakfast every morning. Would not stay in this hotel again, or recommend it to others .

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Decoration Hotel, Strategic Location”
Reviews.Author: adelicious
Reviews.Content: Typcial most of hotel in venice, old roman/victorian decoration, high ceiling, spacious, green fresh color, good view of small/narrow canal, hot water/heater is working good, not much amenities but its ok coz we prepared it. Bfast is standard european style but delicious. Strategic location just step ahead to San Marco, 10mnts walk to Rialto bridge other atraction in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and serene”
Reviews.Author: RonLM
Reviews.Content: We were there on our 20th Wedding Anniversary and were treated wonderfully by the staff who were always very helpful and informative. We were given a room upgrade to a suite which has a huge lounge and king bedroom. The ensuite was small but has all you need - no bath though. The rooms are beautifully decorated in true Venetian style of fabrics,colours and furnishings (we had the green/blue one shown on the web site). It overlooked a small canal - which did not smell at all while we were there - and is in a quiet area, but only 10 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge, right next to Santa Maria Square. Its an easy walk from the Zaccaria Vaporetta stop. Room included breakfast which although basic is enough to get you going as don't want to eat too much given the many cafe's nearby. The hotel has a small lift but the stairs are easy and wide. It was just what we wnated to experience the romance of Venice, in a quiet almost secluded location, but so close to the vibrancy of the main attractions. The price was reasonable as we were just out of he main tourist season, but still the weather was great and we got to experience high tide which flooded St. Mark's square. I would definitely highly recommend this place. PS We are Australian and are a bit more relaxed about 'service' than some of the other tourists, given the trivial complaints in other reviews we read before going - I just think some people expect too much for what they are willing to pay and can find fault in anything!

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: mygardengirl
Reviews.Content: A quiet peaceful hotel. Unfortunately the room at the top of the hotel, which very cosy and nice, had a problem with the air coniditioning. We were moved to another room with large airy windows looking out onto the little canal. The room was small, but then you have to remember you are staying in an old house in Venice.! The little terrace was lovely. Very central and yet quiet. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Undersized - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: jingga18
Reviews.Content: We checked in at this hotel a bit early, at 8.00 in the morning. We knew that our room wouldn't be ready for us due to the time of day. Because of our itinerary, we had to leave our bags at the hotel and leave for the day. We were promised that our bags would be brought to our room and should be waiting for us when we return later that day. This did not happen. In fact, that night we were taken to a different building, which the hotel claims to be their latest premises. Our bags were not there yet and we had to wait for about 10 minutes as the bell-man (he appeared to be the only one on duty that night) had to attend to other customers first. We were assured that the building we were assigned was the newer, better one. I really doubt that's the case. The room was very tiny. The information / floor plan hung on the wall showed that the room was supposed to be a single room. But there were two single beds in the room. The air conditioning wasn't working. The bell-man who took us to our room said that it was deliberately turned off due to time of the year. In Summer the cooling system is on and in Winter they turn the heating system on. In April unfortunately, there's no air-conditioning although the room was so hot & stuffed. We had to open the little window open for ventilation. The paper-thin walls meant that we could hear every single word the people next door were saying. And I reckon they must have heard us too so I'm sure the discontent was mutual. When we asked for wi-fi codes, they didn't have any in this "newer" building. They suggested we used one of the wi-fi providers around the hotel. We supplied our credit card details and no connection was ever available for us. Breakfast was average - your standard European breakfast. Toast, coffee, juice. The only good thing about this hotel is the female receptionist in the morning shift. She is helpful, very informative, and provided us with a Venetian map. She even helped us with waterbus routes. She is the only female staff we met during our stay. The rest of the staff is male. The male receptionist at the later shift is very snobbish and not helpful at all. When we checked out the next day, this male receptionist didn't provide me with a receipt. When I asked for one, it took almost 10 minutes to produce it. It actually took longer to print the receipt than to pay. If you're thinking of booking your stay at this hotel - don't! It's overpriced for an undersized room. Total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Costly Mistake!!! - if you want a below par hotel and an empty bank account - book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James-Cath
Reviews.Content: Firstly - I would like to state we have never left a review of a hotel before - although we use trip advisor and find it very useful we have never been affected enough, either positively or negatively enough by a stay at a hotel to leave a review. My girlfriend had always wanted to see Venice and as I had been once before I decided to treat her and plan a trip for her 28th birthday. I used lastminute.com to book us a long weekend (over Easter bank holidays) to Venice. I stressed over the accommodation for weeks and held off making a booking until the very last minute to try and ensure that we got the best deal and the right hotel. I wouldnâ€™t normally state prices etc. but for the purpose of this review i think it is necessary. In the end we paid Â£1800 for a 3 night stay in Venice (incl. flights). The hotel stay was by far the largest chunk of the bill! Now we had been to Mexico for a week for less than this so my expectations were high. I had booked the Ca' Dei Conti hotel and paid for a suite in the "Conti-Queriniâ€� section of the hotel. The pictures looked amazing, trip advisor reviews were gleaming and so we set off (slightly poorer than usual) to Venice with high expectations and a lot of excitement. When we jumped off the taxi boat in the centre of Venice and made the short walk to the hotel i was overjoyed with the reaction from my girlfriend to Venice and the surroundings - it was a good start and i started to feel that the cost was worth it for her birthday as it was clear she was blown away by the city. We arrived at the hotel - and again - pleasantly surprised! Unfortunately - this is where the good stuff ends!! At check-in I was told (by a very nervous young woman) that the hotel had a burst water pipe and there was no water or aircon to the room we had booked. At first - trying to be sympathetic and understanding I didn't react badly and simply asked what they could do for us. The lady on reception explained that we were being moved for one night to another hotel in the city - OK so far - not too bad..... The porter moved us over to the other hotel - which was fine and we went to check in there.... although the other hotel was perfectly satisfactory it wasnâ€™t the best start to the trip! To start matters off we couldnâ€™t check in for 2 hours as no rooms were ready so we had to leave our bags there and wonder around Venice in the clothes we had travelled in without freshening up or changing etc. I grinned and bared this as it was my girlfriendâ€™s birthday and i didnâ€™t want to spoil things. When we finally did manage to check in to the "temp" hotel we were given a standard room! - strike 2! - We have paid through the nose for a suite and the first night was in a standard room - Iâ€™m already out of pocket! I complained to our hotel (Ca' Dei Conti) and they assured me the next two nights would be with them and in an "upgraded suite"..... After the first night we moved back to the Ca' Dei Conti and initially all was good - we went over early in the morning and they said we could have the room immediately - FANTASTIC! Until i entered the room that was! - It wasnâ€™t a suite - i didnâ€™t resemble any room described on trip advisor and certainly wasnâ€™t clean - there was mould growing on the walls in the bathroom, the walls were scuffed and dirty, the aircon had living organisms growing inside it and the bed may has well have been on the floor as it was sooooo low! I didnâ€™t kick off a the hotel staff as at this point I still thought this was due to a burst water pipe in the other section of the hotel and apart from move us to another hotel again there wouldnâ€™t be much they could do and I didnâ€™t want to ruin what was left of the trip jumping from one hotel to another - however - my frustrations and disappointment hadnâ€™t yet reached its maximum. Whilst speaking to one member of the reception staff on the 2nd morning I noticed the other receptionist pass a key over to a new guest (a French couple) - they key was clearly labelled "Conti-Querini"! I then watched in diss-may as the porter took the French couples bags out of the front door of the hotel and down the canal towards the building housing the "Conti-Querini" suites!! At this point I was FUMING! .... The cost of the trip is what has upset me and the fact I was lied to for no good reason! I can only imagine the hotel was over booked and hence us being juggled about.... If we had booked a trip at a smaller cost and had not paid through the nose for a suite etc. I wouldnâ€™t be writing this review. I very very rarely am so extravagant with holidays etc. but on this occasion as it was my girlfriends birthday and Venice was somewhere she had always wanted to go I felt very let down. All in all we had a good trip and I made sure we enjoyed Venice - all be it the hotel was a massive let down. In summary.... if you want a normal hotel and an empty bank account - book this hotel - HOWEVER - if you are expecting a GOOD hotel or a 4 Star hotel for that matter - DON'T BOOK THIS ONE!!!!! Itâ€™s a total rip off! (The temporary hotel we stayed in on the first night was a better quality!!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and missleading Photos!”
Reviews.Author: Amaya123
Reviews.Content: For over 310 Euro a night we got a very small room in the attic with a tiny window (ca. 15 x 30 cm) and a bathroom that is more like closet! The room had even metal bars crossing from a wall to another as some kind of support to the walls of the old building. Being under the roof, the room was rather warm and the airconditioning was not working. After few calls to the unfreingly receptionist and few hours of time they had it fixed, however, it worked more as a fan and we had to open the tiny window and bear the mosquitos. We had booked this Hotel for our honeymoon after seeing the nice photos on their website, only to be told that our room is in the next building and nothing similar to a decent double room. We complained to the reception aabout the schocking size and quality of the room but they arumented that they were fully booked. They said they will check the next day for a better room but they never got back to us! Another problem with this Hotel is the thin walls. One could hear the neighbouring room even if they sneezed or the elevator everytime it opened. If you want to visit Venice, keep away from this Hotel! For the money you better indulge yourself in one of the best Hotels somewhere outside Venice and take the train down for the day. You could even take one of the cruise ships that make a stop in the city and save yourself a night in an overpriced Hotel like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelOnOccasion_23
Reviews.Content: Like perhaps anything in Venice, it was a little hard to find this hotel when we first arrived. We arrived at the Venice train station, and took the vaporetto waterbus to the San Zaccaria drop-off near Piazza San Marco. This method of getting to the hotel was a little awkward since we had luggage, but it was a nice way to get a look around since it was our first visit to Venice. And the 6.50 euro each for the trip was probably as reasonable as any other method of getting to the hotel. It is possible to walk to the hotel from the San Zaccaria dock without having to climb any of the large stairs over the canal along the waterfront (which we learned the hard way). There is a dedicated, unavoidable staircase over the canal to get to the front door of the hotel. Once you start walking around Venice, it was clear that walking between the hotel and the waterfront near Piazza San Marco, where you can catch the vaporetto, was pretty convenient. Our room was #103. It is directly off the lobby, in a corner next to the front entrance. We were a little shocked, initially, because it felt as if we were being placed into a closet off the lobby. The staff asked us to give it a try, and let them know if we would like a change. We were scheduled to stay two nights. Good stuff about the hotel/room: - The room itself was nice and clean. - The bathroom was large and modern. - The breakfast, provided on the second floor, was good. - Although the staff acted a little stuffy, they spoke OK English, and satisfied all of our requests. Not-so-good stuff about hotel/room: - The hotel charged a pretty steep price for wireless internet access. For the price we paid for the room, we thought it was poor to charge for what has become a basic service at most hotels. - The window in the room looked out onto the narrow canal and walkway in front of the hotel. We could hear tourists and merchants walking and talking on the walkway. Once in a while, a water taxi boat parked outside would start up and drive off. We could hear this also. - The room was right off the lobby. Guests often sat in the lobby and talked. We could hear this in our room clearly. It did not continue into the night, but was mildly annoying. - On the second morning, a vacuum-boat parked directly outside our room's window in the canal. It had a loud motor that was sucking fluid from a business down the way that appeared to have flooded. There was a very strong smell of sewage during this event. Not really the hotel's fault, but a reality of the location. We slept well in the room. Another room on one of the other floors might have been quieter. However, on the second floor, the rooms opened directly into the seating area where breakfast was served. So one issue might just be traded for another issue. Space is a real premium in Venice, so this might have been a reality at any hotel. Ca' dei Conti is the only hotel we experienced in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NCR1030
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay in this lovely little hotel was great! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, our room and bathroom was beautiful, large and very clean. The breakfast was served in a small but lovely dining room and the breakfast was delicious....they even offer eggs and bacon if you can't give up your traditional American breakfast while you're there(although I think there is a slight upcharge for it). The hotel is a quick 5 minute walk from St. Mark's square and a 3 minute walk from the nearest Vaporetti stand. We stayed in 6 different hotels during our time in Italy and this one was by far the best experience we had hands down!

Reviews.Title: “NOT misleading pictures on website”
Reviews.Author: FarAway054
Reviews.Content: What you see, it's what you get. Lovely decorated, clean & spacious room and bathroom. I read all of the reviews and got a pretty good idea of the location. Once there we ask for the hotel and were pointed to it with no problem. English speaking staff. Do not carry a lot of luggage to go to Venice. I would return to this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little palace in Venice”
Reviews.Author: albnas
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice and it happened during the "Carnevale", when the city was really crowded. After diligently browsing several hotels on the web, we decided to make our 3-night reservation for the Ca' dei Conti mostly because of the size and decoration of its rooms as shown on their website. Also, it's just a five minute walk from San Marco. And we were not disappointed: this was a very large room, even for US standards, and the decoration was absolutely beautiful. We felt like being in our little palace, surrounded by nice furniture, a king size bed and all the amenities one would expect - the room had even a chandellier! What could be a minor inconvenience for some (not for us)is that our room was in an annex, maybe a 100 yards from the main building, that according to the hotel staff was purchased about a year ago and then renovated. The annex has an elevator and its own dinning room where the breakfast is served - a good variety of bread, fruit, juices, cereal, marmelade, ham and cheese. The front desk staff is young and very energetic and provided us with several tips. One particular girl went the extra mile to help us to seal a box with Carnival masks that we wanted to ship back home by getting us a roll of packing tape, since we didn't have one. The only thing that we did not like is that they don't have free wi-fi and it's expensive to get it - 6 euros for one hour, if I'm not mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in an overated city”
Reviews.Author: chrissiemccartney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after our wedding in Feb 09 but only getting around to writing the review now. We had spent some time looking for a boutique hotel and were delighted when we came across the Ca dei Conti. I had originally booked directly with the hotel but found it 100Euro cheaper on the internet. I contacted the manager and he willingly agreed to reduce the tariff for our stay. We arrived at the hotel quite late in the evening after getting very lost. It is not easy to find and the Venetians are not the most helpful people in the world. Check in took some time as others had arrived at the same time and we spent around a half hour waiting in the small foyer. We were allocated the Green Room and it was beautiful with a lovely living area and nice bathroom. We only had breakfast one morning in the hotel as I was stuck down with salmonella food poisoning on the third day and spent the last couple of days the trip very unwell. Still unsure where exactly I picked this up, as any food we ate in the city was tastless and extremely overpriced. We paid over 70 euro for a bottle of white wine and a shared dish of pasta! Still to this day we cannot believe how expensive one meal was and this was not anywhere near St Marks Sq or the waterfront- absolutely scandalous! In summation the hotel was fine. The staff did their jobs but were not friendly and never went out of their way to offer advice or even have a conversation with us. No one was in the slightest interested or cared that we were celebrating such a special ocassion and we found the Ventians quite arrogant. We did not particulary enjoy Venice and would never return. Yes the food poisoning was a nightmare but besides this we found Venice to be lacking in atmosphere and warmth. It was very difficult to find anywhere nice to dine or have a drink ( I had bought lots of lovely honeymoon outfits and never got to wear them). Everywhere is very overpriced and we seemed to just spend ages walking in circles trying to find somewhere decent to have a meal and a drink. We still regret not spending our honeymoon in the beautiful Krakow! Venice was a big let down for us.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading pictures on Website”
Reviews.Author: cordi494
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel after seeing the pictures on official website. The room we where given was not shown at all. Very poor, approx 12 x 12 and no room to swing a gondalier. The bathroom was awash after showering every morning. Our room was right by the front door and we heard everyone entering and leaving at all hours. We where not located within the main Hotel but within an annex situated some 200 mtrs away. My wife and I where quite dismayed that the website was very misleading and displayed images we never even saw. Breakfast was adequate but 2.50 euros for scrambled eggs that looked like they had been there all night, I don't think so. Who gave this place 4 *. Overall, think before you book this squalid little place in beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The Lobby and Staff Seemed Nice...”
Reviews.Author: eighthwonder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room in this hotel after doing extensive research on hotels in the area, but when we arrived at the hotel to check in were informed that the hotel had been overbooked and that we were being moved to a different hotel. At first we were mortified because we thought that we would be losing the great location, the traditional Venetian decor that we wanted, or the quality of hotel that we had booked, but to our pleasant surprise were quickly guided by staff to a nearby hotel of similar quality and style. The staff at this hotel was friendly and we were ultimately very happy with the hotel that we were placed in (Hotel Santa Marina), so I'm giving the Hotel Ca' Dei Conti a good review for their quick remedy of the situation, however you may want to stay away from this hotel during the busy summer season if you are very particular about hotels and would not be open to being placed in a "comparable" room.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gillie270361
Reviews.Content: Very tricky to find, but once you have oh WOW!!! Staff were extremely helpful and our room was beautifully prepared and very comfortable. We liked it because it all felt Venetian rather than corporate or multi-national. Close to all the 'big sights' but take a tip and explore lesser known local areas, you can eat Soooo well and at reasonable cost with lovely food.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel Ca dei confusing"”
Reviews.Author: traveller4758
Reviews.Content: Having travelled around 6 hours from home (to airport, flight, coach and then waterbus) i was relieved to finally arrive in Venice. First impressions, beautiful place and seemed very busy with tourists and trinket shops, pizzerias, fashion shops etc... After asking several locals for directions we finally arrived at the Hotel. On first impressions, the hotel seemed very modern and upto date we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who then had his colleague carry my back to our room (THANK GOD, after all that travelling with it) and we were taken in the lift to room 401. Travelling with my boyfriend(24) and myself(21) the guy opened our room to a matchbox sized room with a double bed and a wardrobe with no space to even shuffle around the bed. Also some kind of strange fabric hanging behind the bed? which i did not understand. After sitting and looking around the room i decided we were there for a special occassion (my 21st birthday) and i wasnt pleased with what we were given and within a moment of complaining about the room we were moved into 105 a lovely room with lots of space, a large comfortable double bed and extra wardrobe space seperate. Very clean, cushioned walls decorated venetian style and with a large bathroom. I was happy with this. Breakfast was good, continental style which is all you need to start the day. I wouldn't reccomend Venice to anyone under the age of 40 unless you are interested in architecture and looking at buildings. After being in Venice for 30mins we soon realised there was not much more than the shops i stated earlier finding it extremely hard to find anywhere to sit and have a drink together all 'bars' are coffee and cake bars which just sell alchol too. The hotel bar was very shoddy, just the breakfast bar with some bottles of spirit on but no-one else sat there or a bar person serving. Very strange for a supposid 4* hotel bar... On the whole i had a lovely time because of the company i had, however i wouldnt return to venice.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: wickedwillingwench
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews about this hotel and had some concern. All my fears were put aside upon checking in. The only negative thing about this hotel was finding it...their map and directions could be simplified. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was a bit on the small side but this IS Europe, after all... it was nice appointed and clean. The central 'reading room' (ie salon) was very nice with available computer and internet for guest use. The lobby was very nice. The breakfast buffet was a continental style but I feel more...fresh fruit, cereal, cold meats and cheese...and it was WONDERFUL to wake up to the smell of hot croissants wafting into our room each morning. The eggs and bacon looked good altho we didn't try them for the additional charge. All in all, I found the Ca' dei Conti to be a lovely little hotel and would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, very central, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: RoyPam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, the directions to the hotel, from their web site were perfect and we found it within 10 mins of leaving the boat at St Marks square.Located within 10 mins of St Marks square and also the Rialto bridge. Staff were always polite and helpfull, our room on theground floor overlooked the small canal, the room temperature was easily controllable when you had mastered the controller, the mini bar prices were reasonable for Venice. Th breakfasts were adequate and tasty, a little more variation may be better, overall a lovely stay and would definately recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: FrancesDecatur
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel to stay. Great location (when you find it!). 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Pleasant & helpful staff. Rooms were in good condition & clean, same for bathrooms. Breakfast was plentiful. Eggs & bacon were extra, but there was plenty of other breakfast items available. I would stay here again. Our room was the first door as you walked in the front door of the hotel and I though that might be a problem, but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: betamagic
Reviews.Content: PROS: â€¢ Great location CONS: â€¢ Filthy, old carpets â€¢ Poor quality bed and pillows weren't comfortable â€¢ Staff was rude and unhelpful â€¢Â climate control didn't work There are lots of places to stay in Venice. Choose a different place to stay. We were very excited to stay at a "four star" hotel. The location was great, and the price was severely discounted for off-peak stays. After our three pre-paid nights, we moved to a "three star" hotel that was MUCH nicer. I have no idea how this place got rated as four star; it really seems like a two star. I was given incorrect information by two rude staff members. When I pointed out later that the information was wrong, both guys just pretended like they had never given me the wrong information in the first place. It was bizarre! In fact, RIGHT after I came in and said that the directions on their website left out a step for how to find the place, two Americans complained that the place was hard to find. The night staff guy actually said, "no one has complained before." I couldn't believe my ears. Moreover, several trip advisor reviews discuss the difficulty of finding the hotel. "Climate control" didn't work. Our room was swelteringly overheated. We had to alternate between opening the windows (the heat would cut off then) and getting too cold, then closing the window and getting too hot. I looked at some of the "photos" of this place online. I think they're digital mock-ups of what the place would look like after some much-needed renovating. The furniture and carpets are old and aren't clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: elmarko
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is a simple .10 minute was from Piazza San Marco and the Zaccaria water taxi/Vaporetto station. Staff was a little stiff, but helpful. We had booked a large junior suite only to find out it included a separate and large sitting room with tons of space. Breakfast was very meager and served in a very small room. Do like the Venetians and grab you croissants and capuccinos after you leave the hotel. Located in very quite, private area but close to tons of restaurants. They have a computer available for guests only at 2 E per half hour, which if very, very inexpensive, that is if you don't bring your own! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay of two nights and can recommend this hotel without any qualms. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, ESPECIALLY IN VENICE.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience for 200 euro/night”
Reviews.Author: predino
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY THERE. Awful smelly bathroom (see foto), fake politely on behalf of the staff, terrible breakfast ( they asked us to pay for an egg ). When we ask to change rooms, they told us that no room was available and that if we want to change hotel we have to pay cancellation fee. The location is wonderful but we asked other hotels nearby and we found half price with better quality. I really do not recommend this hotel to anyone apart from mouses. See foto for more details.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful small hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Mufiin
Reviews.Content: A quite small hotel, and a bit difficult to find the first day, men very very nice. The rooms are quite large, not to soft beds, large bathrooms and good storage for clothes. It only takes about 5 min to walk to Marcus square, and only 3 min to all the water buses. A very nice small hotel. Would defiantly recommend it, and we very there for 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jiames_jane
Reviews.Content: The hotel took a bit of finding but once there we could not fault the location. 10 minute walk from St Marks. The room we booked was very spacious and we did enjoy the secluded terrace at the end of the day where we sat drank our own wine purchased from the local wine shop. Breakfast was good to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suki45
Reviews.Content: I am at a loss to understand the negative reviews of this hotel - we have just returned from a 4 day stay and the hotel and staff were fantastic. The receptionists could not have been more helpful and friendly , the breakfast was extremely good and the rooms were beautifully decorated and immaculately clean . The hotel is in a quiet location , five minutes walk from St.Marks Square and the waterfront . We all slept very well , as the beds were very comfortable and there is no noise whatsoever at night . The reception staff arranged a trip to Murano for us , the guide arrived within minutes of booking, and we spent a lovely day on Murano Island . Without exception, all of the staff we encountered were courtious, helpful and friendly , the rooms were exactly as booked . I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjganovsky
Reviews.Content: Loved that it was hidden off the beaten path in a quiet neighborhood, yet so close to everything. Our rooms were very clean and the staff was very nice to my husband and I our two sons and my parents. I thought the Hotel was charming. We all enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place....”
Reviews.Author: AChitnis
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying in this place. Staff with the exception of a lady (i forget her name) were cold and exteremley un helpful. The AC in the room was not working and inspite of complaining nothing was done about it. Be careful of what you inform the front desk as some staff are hand on gloves with local taxi operators who fleece you!! The room was in the new portion of the hotel, just next to the breakfast room. So you get all the noises from early morning of cutlery and people :(( Breakfast was pathetic...if u want eggs, be prepared to pay for it!! Location was not great at all. Although close to San Marco, it is in the inside lanes and water taxis cannot go there if the tide is high!! Be prepared to lug you bags from San Zachaaria... As above, staff are cold and not welcoming. They do not even respond to your greetings!! All in all, a completely avoidable place....there are better option travellers.... A Chitnis

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: FellWalkers_10
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening we were informed that there was no room for us and we could not stay at the hotel. After several hours of arguing we were escorted with our bags to a 'sister' hotel and offered a terrible room for the night - by that time very late and no time for dinner. The next morning we met the manager at Ca dei Conti who explained there had been a mistake by the receptionist and our booked room was available after all! He refused to offer reasonable compensation and claimed we had received equivalent alternative accommodation. After much arguing we were eventually offered derisory compensation which was sent to us several weeks later after chasing. Overall a terrible experience and deplorable service. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: KatieCharlotte
Reviews.Content: The Ca' dei Conti is a cute little hotel. The location is great. It's in a nice quiet neighborhood, so there aren't a lot of crowds nearby. However, it's about 5 minutes away from all of the exciting tourist spots. So you're close by, but still a bit off the beaten path. Definitely a great location and we had a beautiful view of our own little canal below. The room was spacious and very nice. The continental breakfast was okay - a spread of breads, meats, and fruit was available each morning. The staff was not as helpful as I would like. We always had to wait to ask for help, even if there was no one else in the lobby. They just always took their time getting to us. A bottle of prosecco and a trip to Murano were included with our room, but we had to ask the staff about each one - if we hadn't, I'm not sure we would have ever received them.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WoodieinItaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early May and loved everything about it: the location, the gorgeous room, the service and the excellent breakfast. What's not to like?? Book it now if they have a room!

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing part of our trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: qwerqwer
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bedlinen clean.Staff very pleasant. Great location. Rooms tiny and very very dark. Beds tiny and rooms noisy. In a way it ruined our trip which I was looking forward to for months

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: yoyoyomumbai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our honeymoon... we were at venice for two nights.... the manager at the lobby was somewhat "cold" but he did upgrade us to a superior room overlooking the canal (you cant really see the canal from 3rd floor unless you stick you full head out the window and look down)... which was nice of him.... we got a room in the building close by where you check in (not in the same bld as you checkin)... the room was an attic room.... where the bed was it was sunken in and the bathroom and small table area on the higher side of the attic... at first i thought this was a small, dingy room so i went back to the manager and asked if there were any other rooms available... he showed me two more rooms and they were literally half the size as the attic room... so i obviously stayed put.... anyways, the location is fantastic... 5 min walk to san marco square and 10 min to rialto bridge.... great restaurants nearby.... was worth the stay there for what we paid compared to other hotels nearby.... i would stay there again if i got the same rate.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ROUNDSPRING
Reviews.Content: The squashed mosquitos on the walls were an instant indication that the 'canal (narrow, smelly drain ) view' referred to by our very pleasant porter showed his clever use of irony rather than a well appointed room. He was the beginning and end of the 'friendly, helpful' staff. Our twin room was on the ground floor 10 ft from the breakfast room which was very cramped with guests often waiting to sit. The room was therefore quite noisy from 7.30 am. The hotel style was shabby cheap refurbishment ( whole sections of lovely cornicing missing) and faded style. Lots of plastic flowers everywhere. Location however perfect for water taxis, St. Marks etc. Very expensive considering amenities , room quality however this seems de rigeur for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel but beware of being offered attic room.”
Reviews.Author: botswanaireland
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful 5 days in venice, and the hotel is really nice and well located. when we arrived they tried to put us in an attic room, which was really small and full of low beams and dark too. we eventually got a lovely room and had to pay an extra 20 euro a day for the pleasure. the breakfast is great. the trip to murano is not good, they offer free transport to the factory, and when you get there they really push you to buy very expensive glass. i would advise anybody going to murano to go on the normal boat and then you have choice, because there are several factories and thousands of shops and all much cheaper than the one we were sent to.

Reviews.Title: “The horrible coffee overshadowed the amazing Venetian decor...”
Reviews.Author: TheresaJA
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced considering what you get for your money - quite small, shower only, no bathrobes or slippers and terrible terrible coffee. The continental breakfast is good (don't bother with the upgrade to American though, greasy bacon and rubbery scrambled eggs). Watch out for the upgrades and mini bar etc.. All come with lovely promises, not so much delivery and very high price tags. Much like Venice all around I'm afraid ;)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, WOnderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: kristyj8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice, staying in Ca'dei conti hotel. The staff could not have been more hospitable, the room was amazing, extremely clean, and the hotel was in a great location- just between Piazza San Marco, and Rialto Bridge. We stayed there with our 2 children both under 2, and the staff could not have been more accomodating. Breakfast was great, good selection. I would definitley reccomend this hotel to anyone travellling to Venice with children, although would also reccomend travelling to the hotel by water taxi. It drops you about 50 mtrs from the hotel door. If you didn't know the city very well, it could be quite tricky to find. (Although if you can find the St Maria Formosa church, its just around the corner from there!)

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem of a find! You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IsleofAxholmeCossack
Reviews.Content: What a gem!!. Great location, right around corner from Bridge of Sighs, behind the Danielli and 1 minute from St Marc's. Beautiful room. Spotlessly clean. Lovely linen and towels changed every day. Unobtrusive, obliging staff. Quiet and tranquil. Great night sleep. Good breakfast by European standard. We could not have asked fo more. Great value for money. MichÃ¨le- Isle of Axholme

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: danbotoxDevon
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and despite some of the reviews saying it was difficult to find, we had no dramas at all. The staff were very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. There are lots of places to eat near by and getting St marks takes 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “room not as described,price ridiculous for the standard”
Reviews.Author: collector0664
Reviews.Content: although the staff was first class,extremely friendly and helpful and the room was in a good state,I was very disappointed. I specially booked a "luxury superior room with lovely view of the canal". The room was very clean,but in a renovated building in another street than the main hotel, there was no sign of any canal-view,but a "lovely" view of an opposite wall.... Then,for 450 â‚¬ per night I expect a bathtub!! This luxury superior room only had a douche. Breakfast was very,very modest:two kinds of cheese,some salami,butter and jam.For ham and eggs one has to pay extra!! For this price the value is absolutely not acceptible.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Biljana321
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It was one of our honeymoon stops and we couldn't have found a better hotel in Venice. It very close to Piazza San Marco which was helpful in finding the hotel since all signs lead to San Marco. It's in a very walkable location. We splurged and got the suite. The room was gigantic (actually two rooms - a living room and a bedroom) The included breakfast was excellent. This had to be one of our most romantic stops on the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic escape!”
Reviews.Author: ErasmusTraveller
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. The decoration in this hotel was beautiful, every detail was luxurious. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the bathroom was clean and spacious. The room itself was small but so beautifully decorated I could not complain! The room was so romantically decorated there was no way that you could not feel overwhelmed by the beauty of Venice outside your window. The hotel was not far from the main sights, a 5 minute walk at most. The food was very unusual and not particularly pleasant but there was plenty to choose from outside the hotel - although restaurants were very expensive as you might expect! We also took a trip to a neighbouring island - Lido. The beach was lovely and walking around the town was fun as it was very different to Venice. A must see are the orchestra's playing in Piazza San Marco. Take a wander down in the evening and bask in Italian culture.

Reviews.Title: “great location, a secret delight.”
Reviews.Author: stampie23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin share room on the top floor and it was brilliant, very cozy with fantastic interiors. it was very special to be able to open the wooden shutters over the windows and welcome the world every morning. the staff where helpful and the facilites and breakfast where great. The location was brilliant close to every thing but a little hard to find at first.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Elegance and Comfort in Premier Venice Location Close to Sites but Away From Crowds!”
Reviews.Author: mattmc1976
Reviews.Content: Everyone must visit Venice at some point in their life as there is no place in the world like it. They say the city is sinking and the water is rising and that it will one day disappear becoming a piece of history. Because of this, just about EVERYONE in the world DOES visit which is easily noticed by the crowds of tourists (even in the off-season) meandering their way through the narrow and pedestrian-congested maze-like streets. In turn, the local businesses cash in on this by inflating prices on EVERYTHING moreso than any other part of Italy. Since tourists are the majority in this magnificent city, the locals tend to be much less friendly and only acknowledge your existence if you are spending your Euros in their establishment. Because of the crowds and prices, Venice was by far our least favorite city in Italy. In our opinion, Ca dei Conti was the "saving-grace" of Venice. We will most likely never return to Venice, but if we do, we will without any hesitation choose to stay again at Ca dei Conti! LOCATION - If arriving by water-taxi, the closest connection point is San Zaccaria pier. The hotel is tucked away in its own little corner of Venice and one of the street names is incorrect in their directions, so even following their directions on their website, we had to stop and ask a couple of locals for directions or we would have never found it. Even with the directions from the hotel's website, it took us about 25 minutes to finally find the hotel. After learning the streets, we returned numerous times to the pier in 5 minutes walking. St. Marks Square is considered the to be the center of Venice and the premier location for accomodations. Since St. Marks is the center, the area is jam-packed with tourists at all hours. Ca dei Conti is in San Zaccaria, far enough from the crowds that the streats seem amazingly empty, yet close enough to all the major attractions by walking. St. Marks Square and the San Zaccaria Pier are 5 minutes walking and the Rialto and Grand Canal are about 10 minutes by walking. Do not go back to San Zaccaria pier to follow the water to St. Marks! There are "backstreets" to take which will lead you to St. Marks in less than 5 minutes. Also, if you are taking a water-taxi in the direction of Piazale Roma (Santa Lucia RR Station) you may want to walk to the water-taxi pier at Ponte Rialto and catch it there rather than at San Zaccaria. It can cut about 20 minutes off the slow water-taxi ride. Inquire with the reception the first time you venture out to find the quickest routes to attractions and where to catch the water-taxi. ROOM FEATURES AND AMENITITES - Upon entering room 303 (Double Superior) we were amazed at the spaciousness and elegance of the decor. The room was absolutely beautiful - decorated in royal blue and gold giving a feeling of elegance without being "over-the-top" which can happen in many Italian hotels trying to acheive an atmosphere of "refined elegance." In the entry, there were large closets which provided ample space to store all our luggage; also where the minisafe was located. The mattress and linens were comfortable and of quality. There was ample space for sitting and lounging either on the sofa-sleeper or in one of the chairs around a small end table in the corner of the room. Two windows opened up to a charming view onto the Ca dei Conti's private bridge crossing the small canal below and directly across at a typical Venetian building. The bathroom featured marble countertops, heated floor and towel racks, bath amenities, ample quality towels and a relaxing hydromassage tub and shower combo. No details were missed - soft carpet covered the floor AND walls were covered in fabric wallpaper. There was even a remote control next to the bed that controlled the lights and television (it may have controlled the heat/ac also, but I never had to use it for that so I don't recall.) BREAKFAST - Featured breads and pastries, fruits, ham, salami, cheese, dry cereals, milk juices and coffee. Eggs and bacon were available for a fee which seems to annoy many American visitors, however, it's typical of most hotels in Italy. PRICE - Higher than most from the US are used to paying for a hotel, but, when compared to other similar Venice hotels the price is quite reasonable and in my opinion, well worth it! CONCLUSION - Ca dei Conti is perfect in all aspects considering price, amenities and location. I highly recommend to anyone looking for a unique boutique hotel with rooms loaded with local charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spacious Room!”
Reviews.Author: kaychris
Reviews.Content: This was the last spot we stayed for our honeymoon and it was terrific! We enjoyed the champagne in the room and breakfast in the morning. The room was extremely spacious and well decorated! The only downside is trying to find your way to the hotel at night. It isn't too far from St. Marks, but even with a map it can be a little tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: LivingOrange
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Venice finally drove us to add to the reviews after using Trip Advisor religiously for several years. For us, customer service makes or breaks any experience , for better or worse. Our experience with this hotel was overall very positive, though admittedly, our expectation were tempered from the beginning. The location was great (close to San Marco and Rialto), front desk staff was friendly and the included breakfast decent. The decor was dated but in classic Venice style which we considered part of the experience. We figured they really couldn't have used the small bathroom space more efficiently but, like another reviewer, found the shower barrier failed to keep water from the floor. The tacky: An extra $2.50 charge to eat the scrambled eggs and bacon with the breakfast buffet. Our friends travelling with us found their top floor room had a very low ceiling and discovered the rain had soaked the bedding through an open window. They seemed very content with their room after they relocated.

Reviews.Title: “Top floor with lift”
Reviews.Author: TheHolidayMonster
Reviews.Content: Location - Excellent. Two minutes walk from San Marco but away from crowds Staff - Were all poite & friendly from reception to maids Room - Room 405 top floor. Large & clean. Shower & whirlpool bath. Word of caution room 107 was off the breakfast room Cleanliness - Room cleaned daily. Public areas spotless Food - Breakfast in small breakfast room. Reasonable choice & typical continental breakfast. You pay extra for fried breakfast. If all guests decended on breakfast room at same time it would be not large enough to cope Try taking a stroll to the Castella distict including St Peters church. A walk down Casse Garibaldi gets you away from most tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a mixture!”
Reviews.Author: snowymilou
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet but central. The room was clean and the maid service excellent, fresh clean sheets daily and loads of towels. The fixed shower screen made it hard to shower without flooding the bathroom and the jets in the bath were a problem. The reception staff were unfriendly and varied in howe helpful they were more than I would usually expect. It was more than a little puzzling to have to surrender my passport before I could use the computer to check in to my flight on-line , the given rationale being so that the police could check my internet use. The mattress on the folding bed was thin but bearable but the mattresses on the regular beds were fine. Breakfast was emminently missable, the croissants were overheated and hard, the coffee (in Italy forsooth!) foul and the rolls were stale. Would recommend location but would be clear about the limitations I found.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding-- with slight problems”
Reviews.Author: MC_Orlando
Reviews.Content: Wow! Outstanding hotel. However, upon arriving, we were advised there were plumbing problems with the hotel and we were relocated to a sister hotel "Santa Marina" for one of our two nights; I will do a seperate review. Upon, staying at both hotels, my only disappointment was we did not get to stay both nights at the Ca' Dei Conti (the Santa Marina was good too). I tend to believe they may have overbooked this hotel, or this was a method to keep the sister hotel more fully booked-- be warned. I expect if this is a tactic, the reviews will ferret it out. Now, back to the review. This hotel is superb. Absolutely beautiful. Nice location, a very short walk to St. Marco, but just enough out of the way to be very quiet, cozy, and romantic. Our room was HUGE even by American standards, and finely appointed. The only thing small was the bath and expecially the shower. I "dropped the soap" and was not able to bend down to reach it-- instead I had to exit the shower to retrieve it! The room had all the bells and whistles, everything you need, and just absolutely comfortable and lovely. Very helpful staff, and a reasonable breakfast. They charged an extra 2 Euro at breakfast for eggs or bacon, and given the quality of the hotel-- it seemed a very petty practice. Other than these items, this hotel is outstanding. I dream of staying here again. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: “A variable experience”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: The Ca' dei Conti Hotel website looks fantastic - and it may well be as good as it appears. Unfortunately, having booked a six night stay at a cost of Â£1,600, we didn't actually get to stay there! Despite having paid 300 Euros for an upgrade to a superior room ("overlooking the canal"), we arrived to discover that we had been assigned to the Conti Querini, an overflow building a couple of minutes from the main hotel. While the room was a decent size, it certainly didn't match the description on the website. Rather than a canal view, we overlooked a small courtyard and the wall of a nearby church. The en suite bathroom was pretty two star, with a very dodgy floor and a pair of saloon style doors which just didn't close. When we arrived, despite having booked a twin room, we were shown to a double, although this was remedied while we went out to dinner. A minor issue, but it does show a lack of attention to detail which wouldn't be expected from a hotel which describes itself as a four star establishment. The disadvantage of being in the annex hotel is that it lacks any reception. Instead, every hall and corridor is monitored by a rather creepy CCTV system (rather like being back in surveillance obsessed Britain, in fact!) There is no bar. The guest lounge was a two armchair affair which failed to impress. On two days of our stay, the public rooms did smell strongly of overflowing lavatories. It could have been the nearby canal, but... The breakfast room was very basic and right outside rooms 605, 606 and 607, so if you are given these rooms expect to hear the staff setting up from around 7 am each morning. There are only six tables provided and these are packed together, so if intimate breakfasts are your thing, look elsewhere. On one particularly bad day, we actually had to set our own table and there were other guests hanging about waiting for a free table. Definitely one star, not four. Other reviewers have commented on the requirement to pay for eggs and ham... again, not an impressive touch. On the plus side, the cleaning and laundry service were very good and the rooms were quiet at night. It is also well placed and genuinely close to S. Marco's Square. Our recommendation is that if you decide to book this hotel, you absolutely ensure you are booking a room in the actual Ca' dei Conti. Accept nothing else, particularly the rather disappointing Conti Querini round the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traintrippers84
Reviews.Content: We had room 302 (i think) on the second floor with access to lovely terrace. Room was lovely and roomy and bathroom was good too. We found the staff always helpful. Breakfast was adequate but not great and the coffee (there was one of those multi-choice dispensers) was truly awful. We couldn't understand why Italians could serve such awful coffee!! It was great to be so central and we popped back during the day to drop off bags which was really useful. We'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel - service sometimes 'iffy'”
Reviews.Author: Pen-zance66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 30 Sep 09 to 05 Oct 09. Had booked 'the comfort room' in the adjoining Palazzo Conti Querini but when we checked in we were shown to a small double room on the 2nd floor of the main hotel. I queried this and said it wasn't what I'd booked. Grudgingly they showed us to the another room in the Palazzo Conti Querini, just around the corner. This was bigger (not that much) and nicer. The member of staff who showed us there said that people always think they are booking something different as the picture on the website is that of the suite. I told him that there were two pictures on the website and on the strength of that I had booked, not the suite but the comfort room. It turns out there are several rooms, including I believe 2 suites in the Palazzo Conti Querini. Some of these adjoin the breakfast room, which I wouldn't have liked. We had room 612 on the 2nd floor - it was very nice - a small double but adequate. The en-suite bathroom was very stylish and clean. There was a corner bath but no shower apart from a hand held one but this wasn't a big problem. Air conditioning was nice, even though you had to get reception to alter the temperature. The room was pretty quiet, apart from it seemed we could very clearly hear the people beneath us. Breakfast was basic but good - fruit, yoghurt, cereals, bread, toast, croissants, cold meat and cheese with tea and coffee. There was egg and bacon available for an extra payment. Asked about wi-fi and was told that it was available but would cost 12 euros for 2 hours and would expire at midnight (we asked at around 6 in the evening). I searched on my iphone for the wi-fi and when prompted for payment, found that I could get an hour's use for just 6 euros and actually this lasted me my entire stay (I could also use it in my room, not just in the main hotel lobby) but I wasn't made aware of this option at all. The hotel is in a great location, about 5 mins walk from St Mark's Square and is in a quiet area.
