Overall I would recommend it but it just lacks a little on the service, although I think this is attributable to a couple of members of staff rather than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, nice location, but”
Reviews.Author: haconstruct
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel; had a nice huge two room suite which was fantastically decorated and like new. Bathroom was perfect and the flat screen TV's nice. Rooms overlooked the canal. Booked directly thru hotel and thought price was consistent with hotel and Venice. However, the staff were less than satisfactory. Not quite rude, but close. And the breakfast rooms are small and food selection limited and mostly cold and stall. Did have eggs as an upgrade for 2.5 euros - scrambled eggs in a steamer. Yuck! If you want a nice hotel, eat out and do not need to interact with staff, this is a great hotel, but with all the selections available, I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: WiwiThailand
Reviews.Content: Staff have a good service mind and willingness. Room is clean. Breakfast is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Apassionfortravel11
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights as part of our Honeymoon in July 2008 and this was an absolute gem of a hotel! The room we had was extraordinarily beautiful and overlooking the canal! It very much has a boutique hotel feel and lovely detailing. The breakfast room was quaint and the location was wonderful! We hope to return to Venice one day and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Special in a good way”
Reviews.Author: KristalClear
Reviews.Content: When we found this hotel on internet we couldn't even look at others. their website looks great and I was looking forward to discover if the reality raises up to the expectations. And it did. We had a room with a mezzanine, the rooms were spacious, 2 TVs (we never used them though), nice clean bathroom with bathtub, king size bed, pretty special atmosphere overall.

Reviews.Title: “Ca' dei Conti: Nice Little Hotel Near St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Ca' dei Conti the first week of September and was rather pleased with the property and my stay. The hotel itself is just a couple of minutes walk from St. Mark's Square in Venice. To get there, you can take public transport from the Airport and get off at San Zaccaria, just a couple of minutes walk from the boat station. Getting to the hotel might be a little tricky, as it is a couple of blocks off of a major thoroughfare, we found it by accident. But once you orient yourself, it's no problem. We stayed on the fifth floor in an attic room with two twin beds. The room was spacious by European standards, with the layout planned in a way to take advantage of the architecture. In addition to two beds that were on opposite ends of the room, there was a little sitting area and a good amount of open space. One nice feature is that they had two flat screen tvs next to each bed, so two people could watch different programs (if you can deal with the noise). The bathroom was mid-sized; it wasn't spacious and it wasn't cramped either. There was even a window in our ceiling, almost akin to a skylight, with motorized panes and blinds that could be controlled with a console on the wall. The hotel has five floors, with the fifth level being the attic rooms. There is an elevator in the hotel, but it doesn't go all the way up to five. I also noticed that the hotel had a reading area and balcony that were for use by guests, but I didn't use either, so I can't comment on them. When we arrived, the staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly enough. No complaints there. The hotel is located on the other side of a small canal. To access it, you will have to go over a small bridge, so if you need handicapped access, this will not be the hotel for you. Breakfast was available at 7:30 a.m. in the morning with freshly made croissants and rolls, cold cuts (hams, cheese), fruit, juice, milk, and cereal. Bacon and eggs are also available, but you have to pay extra to consume them. There are some nice places to eat if you walk a couple of minutes from the hotel. The hotel does not have a restaurant on site. Since we arrived shortly before the Venice film festival, room rates were quite high but the Ca' de Conti was one of the more reasonable choices available to us. My only complaints with the hotel was that though there was air conditioning in the room wasn't as powerful as we would have liked. It took a long time for it to get noticeably cooler in the room and it never got as cool as we would have liked. Despite that however, the Ca' dei Conti was enjoyable to stay at and I would definitely recommend it to friends and other travelers on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: gring0mama
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice, and took a $80 boat trip from the train station to the San Marco dock. Then, a 10-minute walk through the most congested piazza in Venice and several narrow alleys and lots of steps to get to the hotel. The room was so small that it did not have a dresser, and to open our suitcases, we could not walk on either side of the bed. We requested a new room, and got one slightly larger. No relief, though, as the air conditioning didn't cool. We asked the desk manager to increase the temperature in the room (outdoor temp was 90+F), but he said he was not permitted to do so. The hallway was cooler, so we slept with the door to our room open! Needless to say, we had three sleepless, sweaty nights. The room was in desperate need of re-decorating, although the bath appeared to be recently up-dated. There was no internet, no robes in the bath, no room service one English-language newspaper for the entire hotel (which was stolen every morning by 9). Although breakfast was included, eggs were an extra charge. The staff was rude.This is definitely NOT a 4-star hotel. Don't even think about staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - gloomy room”
Reviews.Author: basilturnip
Reviews.Content: I was feeling a bit wary about this hotel because of the mixed reviews. However, when we arrived I was really pleased with the quality of the room. it was spacious and well furnished,and very clean, it even had a private terrace with table and chairs and a small kitchen. However in the light of day it was apparent that no light entered this dreary room. The kitchen had absolutely no equipment so we bought a jug to heat water only to discover that the hot plate was not connected to an electricity supply. The worst thng was the leaking shower - the sealant was faulty and after every shower the floor was flooded. We consequently spent a week with sodden towels all over the floor. Not a very 4* experience. The breakfast was ok, basically what you would expect in italy but it did seem a bit mean to charge the extra â‚¬3 for scerambled egg or bacon - again not very 4*! Overall we were happy with the location and the quality of the decor was good, we had gotten a very good deal by paying in full a year in advance so we probably had value for money, however I would not have been happy had I paid the publicised rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: calsand
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is just 2-3 minutes walking distance from St. Mark's Square,. A little hard to find at first, but the staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel itself is clean and well maintained. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival which was nice as we were traveling with our two college-aged daughters. Breakfast was included with the room- a standard continental-type offering: croissants, cereal, yogurt, meats and cheeses, some fresh fruit. Eggs and bacon were available at an extra charge of 3 euro. The hotel is located on a small canal and was very quiet at night. The only drawback was the mattress which was very firm, quite a bit harder than what we prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: anrisavage
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful, perfect location, stunning rooms and furnishings and no doubt the best breakfast in Italy. We stayed on the top floor looking out over Rome and onto a canal. It's quiet at night; we only woke in the morning from the smell of fresh croissants baking in the kitchen. It's a few cobbled streets away from St Marks Square, about 5 minutes walk to Rialto and in an area full of lovely restaurants alive with people until late at night. It remains my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Mkvetnurse
Reviews.Content: we have just returned after staying here for 3 nights to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary.I had read all the reviews and booked with my fingers crossed! no need what a gem of a hotel the location was perfect and our room (208) was a great size the decor was very nice and the hotel had a great feel to it the staff were helpful and we found a bottle of wine in our room to help us celebrate. I woud recommend this hotel and hope to go back as the location was ideal for exploring this wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Venice is beautiful....hotel was too....if we could have stayed there!”
Reviews.Author: AveryAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay two nights which we pre-paid. On arrival at the hotel we were told by reception that there was not a room available for us to stay that night because there was no water in some of the rooms. We were taken to another hotel.....which was around the corner. And told to contact reception the next day to see if the water problem was fixed......all of which you really don't want to worry about when you only hae 2 nights in Venice. Upon checking out of the first hotel ( de Angelo) we were told that the rate per night was $115 Euros at that hotel. by the Reception staff...I had pre-paid approx $250 Euros to stay each night at the Ca'Dei Conti. We stayed the following night at the Ca' Dei Conti because the water issue had been fixed. Upon checking out the next day I mentioned to the Manager that there seems to be a difference in price between the Hotel de Angelo that we had been made to spend the first night in. He did not agree and said the girl must have got it wrong when she quoted $115 Euro's........And did not want to hear anymore of it and even suggested we were offered another room on arrival at the Hotel. Which we were not. With only 2 nights in Venice of course we would have taken this option. The moving from and to hotels was such a waste of our time.......And once something is pre-paid the customer really has no power at all! Something which I think this hotel took advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good To Excellent Choise”
Reviews.Author: spyridon d
Reviews.Content: WE were advised by friengs regarding the hotel and we choose it after giving a great consideration.Even though some of the reviews made us apprehensive(especially the one about the personnel, the rooms being next to the breakfast area, and some othe negative comments) we decided to go ahead. And let me tell you IT WAS VERY GOOD very close to excellent taking under consideration the price we were charge. We had booked initially a standard then we ourselves upgraded to superior and we ended up with a suie. PERFECT We were celebrating our wedding anniversary, we were there on feb 14, and at the weeknd that the carnival started. Let me tell you it was GOOD.The fact tha opening the door we walk into the breakfast area... NO PROBLEM.the staff every time we asked for help it was there SMILING,breakfast was very good and plenty no restrictions. the room was cleaned twice a day .itwas closed to central squrae which was very convient. Shortcomings???? just about none... except if you consider a faulth that the televison wasnt able to follow on any english speaking chanel.BUT LET ME ASK YOU !!!!! WHO WOULD GO TO VENICE ON VALENTINES WEEEKND THE FAMOUS CARNIVAL STARTING AND STAY in the room to WATCH TV??? not me nor my wife . A very good choise, and we thank the people for their hospitality. Now if you want to talk about RUDE PEOPLE.. Try the ladies on the official office of venice tourist service nest to the San MArco boat station. TOTALY RUDE NOT HELPFULL AT ALL Do not byu the 3 day full senior pass it is not worth it Friendly and polite people??? all the ones we encounter that are working on the <<public bus-boat>> FOOD VERY EXPENSIVE we would like to suggest one restaurant taht we remember leaving the hotel and entering a small square on your lesft hand side there is a farmacy turn left walk over the bridge left hand side a rather large place. Decent food no cheating very friendly people worth the price. Also a-beam the farmacy on the corner a pizza parlor also good. If you want to byu original staff e.g. MURANO glass go to the island on the main city be very carefull.if yoy are more than 4 take a taxi to/from the airport worth the price or take the fast boat . If you get sea sic easily then you shoulb consider twice visiting Venice. All and all a very pleasant and memorable experience .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: echo10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in February 09 with husband. The hotel is in a lovely location although difficult to locate at first! Our room was very large with views of the canal which was lovely. The room was clean but some of the furnishings looked a bit tired. Overall it was good value and I would certainly stay here again based on the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the small room”
Reviews.Author: drdobg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ca dei Conti late September 2008. Was a bit concerned about reviews I'd read on Tripadvisor about unacceptably small rooms, and I believe we were placed in just such a room on our arrival. I spoke to the desk immediately and was told that there were no other rooms available that night. With persistence, they agreed to move us the next day to a more acceptable room. Be very wary to check the room and make sure it is acceptable before you accept their room assignment.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous in every sense”
Reviews.Author: IneseJurevica
Reviews.Content: Despite of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, we were still positively surprised and impressed upon arrival. First of all, it is because of an ultimately cute setting of the hotel and elegant lobby, as well as a very courteous stuff. The hotel is rather 4*** - that was our final judgement on the hotel. I would not hesitate a second in choosing it for the next stay. We had a very spatious room on the top floor with a canal view. Gorgeous. It has been really a pleasure spending lazy evenings in the room. We were pleased also by the cleanness of the room (the cleaning was done 2ce per day) and the furnishing - it was very traditional but without worn-out feel. Location - 4 minutes from San Marco, 15 minutes from the Realto bridge. The area is very nice and rather quite - I cannot imagine living by Realto bridge or closer to San Marco - too many people. I would advice to choose this area or near the bridge of Accademia - the latter seemed to be a more exclusive location and definitely our favourite place in Venice. Breakfast - not a very broad selection, but - fresh baked croisans, scrumbled eggs, some fresh friut. (standard 3*** level) Just remembered an amazing detail - in the mornings we could sense a smell of freshly baked croisans - great wake-up call! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Venice is fabulous; not so sure about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: notsolonelyplanateer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our New Year's trip to Venice after reading some great reviews on this website. However I'd advise future guests to be more cautious. The hotel is 3 mins from Piazzo San Marco. Bear in mind, though, that Venice is tiny, and most places are a 10, max 15, minute walk. I'm not convinced that it is worth paying for location, unless you have a view of one of the main sights. The hotel itself is pretty, and the better rooms are well decorated. Beware, however, that a number of rooms lead directly onto reception or the breakfast rooms, which can be noisy. I was awoken at 7am on the first morning, and asked to change rooms. We paid to upgrade to a superior room which was lovely, but brought the total cost to Eur300+ per night - I'm not convinced it's worth that. A couple of other reviews mentioned that the staff were unhelpful or unresponsive in dealing with problems, and I totally agree with this. I sensed that they saw an opportunity to make money from the room switch. We were shown an absolutely awful box room which apparently was the only other Classic room available; the only viable option that they offered was to upgrade. My advice would be to pay less for location - Venice is small and fun to explore, especially away from the crowds of San Marco and Rialto; and use the money on a better hotel. I'd also say that Venice is superb for New Year. It is a beautiful city, the fireworks were great, and the snow starting to fall just before midnight added to its charm!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid !!!!”
Reviews.Author: kormic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in Venice in Ca dei Conti to celebrate our wedding anniversary! The hotel surpised us with a wonderful room! They are professionals! Very friendly and decorated like old Venice. Not only I would definitely stay there but I have already advertised it to everyone I know. This hotel is my number 1. Very close to San Marco 4 minutes walk and everything you need to see. Venice is really magical.

Reviews.Title: “Beware poor service when you complain....”
Reviews.Author: annemarieBalloch
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel is in a great location and the rooms are nice. However, when we had cause to complain because our spa was not working, the reception staff were generally unhelpful. The gentleman who dealt with our complaint was dismissive and actually hinted that we had no reason to complain because we hadn't paid for the spa in the first place! Utter nonsense. Defensive customer care in a hotel of this calibre is totally unacceptable. I would not return to this establishment in future.

Reviews.Title: “romantic and briliant”
Reviews.Author: Mark151
Reviews.Content: This was a brilliant hotel in a perfect location down a very romantic street by one of the canals. We found the hotel staff friendly, knowledgeable, and more than willing to help in every way they could. I booked a double standard room but contacted the hotel via e-mail prior to leaving requesting the best double standard room they had as i was going to propose to my girlfriend whilst in Venice. I also asked for flowers and champagne to be placed in the room on the day of the proposal and asked them for recommendations on a nice place to take her for dinner - they suggested Danieli which I took up. On our arrival they completely surprised us both by placing us in a 2 double bedroom room with our own kitchen and lounge area for no extra cost. They really did make our stay in Venice one to remember. They got us beautiful flowers and champagne as i requested. We don't have a bad word to say about them and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Top marks from us!

Reviews.Title: “Moved hotel”
Reviews.Author: heroin1
Reviews.Content: After researching the hotel I wanted to spend my hotels in I booked the Ca' de Conti in Venice. Unfortunately when we arrived there had apparently been some flooding and we were transferred to its sister hotel the Saint Marina. I was not pleased as this hotel appeared about 5-10 minutes further away. However, after settling into the hotel; finding my way around Venice; and subsequently checking the pictures of the hotel I think we got the better deal. In the Saint Marina Hotel we got juior suites - quite a bit more room and the lobby area of the hotel was a lot bigger than I had seen at Ca'De Conti. In adition, we were literially 5 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: michael1Uk
Reviews.Content: First stay in Venice but will certainly return particularly to this hotel. Minutes from Place San Marco, top class facilities and service. Attention second to none with room serviced at least twice a day. Booked a standard double but comparable to an executive room with excellent facilities and wonderful furnishings. Staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Just perfect. Will return. As Chairman of a tourist Board in UK can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italygirl72
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. It was beautifully appointed and the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and comfortable. It is just a beautiful, grand hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: OxonUktripper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Ca dei Conti. It is very central and if you use the water bus not too far to walk with suitcases. Our room was on the ground floor and opened into the reception and whilst we worried we would be disturbed this only happened once. Some rooms opened into the breakfast room, I am sure they were disturbed and I would advise ensuring you do not get one of these. The Hotel was clean, the service great. June 2008

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: RedBlonde2
Reviews.Content: As a 30 year flight attendant who does 4 - 5 trips a month to Europe, Asia and South America I can tell you that the Hotel Ca' dei Conti is a lovely place to stay. Our room was large by Europe standards, beautifully decorated, a nice bathroom and a perfect location for Venice. The breakfast buffet was a nice bonus and a wonderful way to start your day. Staff was very nice and helpful. You will not be disappointed if you book this hotel. As for me, I need not look any further the next time I need a hotel in VCE. The Hotel Ca' dei Conti is perfect for me and will be my first choice when staying in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I highly recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: ugottaluvrome
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel to stay in!! Their employees were all very professional and helpful. It was very clean & comfortable! We even got a free tour of the Murano Glass factory which I highly recommend taking.!! It was very interesting and beautiful!! What a great surprise that was. The free breakfast was wonderful. You can walk to St. Mark's Square which I highly recommend seeing. There are wonderful restaurants and shops along the way to St. Mark's Square. If you see something buy it because you may not find your way back to that shop. There are so many streets, really walkways that you could get lost. We all want to go back to Venice and we all said we want to stay at this hotel again!!! Also revisit the Murano Glass factory which we purchased birthday gifts!!! Be sure to get a good map if you plan to walk from the boat taxi to your hotel. It can be confusing!! I dreamed about Venice for weeks and we were only there one night. Try to stay longer if you can. We want to go back and stay longer!! This was a great hotel and located in a nice spot!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “marco kept his promise”
Reviews.Author: KALO182
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend stayed at the ca' dei conti for 2 nights.....what a surprise and peace of mind......i booked the hotel directly..when i was in london......because i was really worried that i could not find a beautiful romantic hotel within my budget and ca' dei conti had it all. we are so happy that we stayed there. the manager marco was fantastic...he kept his promise, that he will look after us and he did so. he upgraded us to a suite and we paid 300 euros for two nights check out on the third day at 12...no problems or worries. the suite was outstanding ...just really beautiful clean ...two flat screen tv.......its room 204....you walk out and you have the breakfast room. we got to the hotel without any major problems.....get off at san zaccaria danieli stop on the public boat service......walk straight opposite into calle del rasse (small road) from there walk straight down you will come to a small shopping yard just ask one of the cafe or shop owners ....its 5 minutes away. anyway marco was great he even gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne...it was left in our room in a ice bucket when we cam back in the evening. breakfast was excellent.......everything you need is there......say no more..and theres plenty choice. the staff are all very professional......paul is really fantastic.... overall the hotel is in a lovely area ..its so close to everything.....but thats the magic of this hotel....after a long day you can just chill out and come to a quiet area.....i cant say anything bad about the hotel because we had no problems or worries.....and iam from london...and we moan alot..but i have to say it was great for what i paid ...in the area i was in...and the quality of the hotel. we will go there again because its perfect for us. the only thing we didnt like was the rain!!!!!......

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - GREAT Service”
Reviews.Author: eleuthra
Reviews.Content: Ca' dei Conti Hotel, tucked away on a little side canal about 10 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco was absolutely wonderful. It had been a terrible, overnight Delta flight from JFK to Marco Polo Airport. The water boat ride into Venice, past Murano, through the Grand Canal, helped to wash away the 9 hours of cramped, stuffy, uncomfortable SkyMiles. Our walk, with luggage to the hotel was a bit clumsy. (When advised to travel light in Venice, listen!) But once we settled in to our beautiful room, all was well in the world. The staff at Ca' dei Conti, specifically, Pietro, Marco and Vladimir were so helpful and friendly, making our short, three-night stay that much more enjoyable. They directed us to very good restaurants and were always ready with a map to draw the way. The lobby of the hotel has two stone columns and an old well which date back to the 13th century. The well is enclosed behind a glass wall, but the columns are out in the open - though one of them is a little bent into the wall. But - it's over 800 years old - I'd be a little bent, too. Initially, we looked at a standard room, which was very nice, but opted to treat ourselves and upgraded to a superior room. It was well worth it. Outside our room was a large, comfortable and elegent sitting area. There were a few other rooms off of this community space. Just inside our room's door was a small walkway and closet. Another, seperate door, led into the main room which had a king-size bed, couch and coffee table, beautiful antique writing desk, a flat-screen television as well as two plush chairs and a table next to one of the two windows in the room that both looked out onto a canal. The bathroom was large with a hige sink, deep tub/shower, toilet and bidet. The walls and bed were dressed in green and gold. Normally I find that kind of appointment a bit much, but in this case, it was perfect. Down one floor was the breakfast room. The food was pretty standard - eggs, breads and cheeses, meats, some pastry, VERY good coffee, etc. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for it's attention to detail, beauty and, most important, high-level of customer service. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Room! You won't be dissapointed!!”
Reviews.Author: 3crows
Reviews.Content: Our hotel looked like a beautiful picture postcard. Our beautiful room, 405, was very big, with elegant furnishings, vaulted wood ceiling, and flat screen tv. We had a comfortable king for us and twin bed for our son. The bathroom was all marble and was a nice size too. I was, however, slightly dissappointed to learn that the jaccuzi tub did not work-no biggie. We had a lovely view of tiled rooftops from our window and were about 10 minutes from St. Mark's Sq. Breakfast was the best we had in all of the 5 places we stayed in italy. Fresh cuisants, salami, hams, brie, swiss, (I made a sandwich every morning and looked forward to it each day!), cereals, scrambled eggs, toast, jam, small tarts, juice, coffee and fresh fruit. The staff was very nice and helpful. One young clerk, Mr. V, from Mulvania, always met us with a smile and recommended a good place to eat, pricey, but the clams and speg. was the best we had in Italy. Another older gentleman at the front desk, helped me out of a sticky situation by calling our next hotel in Florence to line up a 3rd night's stay. Our travel agent only booked 2 nights in Florence and I realized we needed 3- OOPS!! It all worked out fine. This was our 20th anniversary trip and I will forever have fond memories of Venice, our favorite place in all of Italy, and this hotel. Thank you Ca' Dei Conti!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacation22
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in Venice on a quite street but close to everything. My husband, 3 kids and myself were very comfortable and the breakfast was delicious. If you stay in Venice, pre book a walking tour with Vatican Tours Inc ([--]). We were led on a 3 hour private walking tour which was a highlight of our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and location”
Reviews.Author: mersavas
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple, and we went to venice in february 2008, and we just loved the hotel, and the room. we stayed in a normal room, and when we went in we were amazed how clean and luxurious the place was, we even had our own terrace garden with a table and our own kitchen too. the hotel is 7-10 min walk awy from st marks square which is the biggest landmark and u can find many restaurants and shops around, also 1 min away from the hotel u have a huge mask shop which also sells very high quality murano glass items. it was a terrific suprise this low budget hotel ended up being nice. also with ur bookings u get a free trip to murano glass factory and island, take it but make sure u book all ur trips as soon as u arrive to ur hotel. dont miss the breakfast either because they provide with a such nice raange of continental range of food at breakfast, which ll keep u full while u walk around all day.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: alecat68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days during Carnevale! I must say the room was perfect for us. Small yes, but who stays long in their room when you are in Venice? My brother and I went there for 3 days (yes I know, how romantic with my brother) but he had never been there before so... I on the other hand have been several times and this is the first place I really felt fit the bill perfectly. We stayed on the top floor in room 505 which was a room with 2 single beds and each bed had its own flat screen tv and the beds where also far enough away from each other that you didnt really hear the other tv. There was also a cute little table and chairs up by the window like a little tea area... very cute. The room had nice furniture, good beds and a very venice like decor. Breakfast was a full array of everything from eggs and toast to croissants, cold cuts, marmalades. The breakfast room was also ok although I don't know who chose the color scheme but too "kitsch" for my taste. For the summer there is also a nice deck on the 2nd floor overlooking the small canal which I can imagine would be great to relax on. Also there is a sitting room where you could go if in fact you need the space just to sit, read and maybe meet new folks. The staff were also helpful for finding restaurants (which is very important in venice) and trip planning. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you get hte right room”
Reviews.Author: IsraelHillel
Reviews.Content: we have ordered a double room. When we arrived we were shocked to see the room which was the size of a king size bed. The room was not close to the size and shape of those rooms that was shown in the internet site. We had been told we should pay 50 eu extra in order to get a normal room. We did so and we enjoy the stay but could not get rid of the feeling that we were cheated and that this ritual is a usual one (see some other reviews of the same issue)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: morosity
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ca' dei Conti for 3 nights in Early January. We absolutely loved it!. We flew with Ryan Air to Treviso airport and caught one of the Ryan Air coaches (9E return) to the Piazzale Roma, where we caught a Vaporetto to the San Zaccaria stop. The Ca' dei Conti was just a short walk away. It's rather hidden, and in a very quiet area, but incredibly close to St. Marks Square and very much accessable from whereever you choose to wander!. The staff were helpful and spoke brilliant English and our room, although rather small, was beautiful and very clean. Our room had beams on the ceiling and a very comfortable double bed and a flat screen TV. The fact that the room was small was not really an issue, as we didn't spend much time in our room. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful... coissants (which were divine!), cereals, tea and coffee, yoghurts, biscuits, fruit and bread rolls. We really did have a wonderful time and I can't wait to return!.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie73344
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel tucked away from the bustle of Venice but 5 mins away rom St Marcs Square. Excellent spot for a romantic break.Lovely room, a bit small, however, well decorated and furnished. A bigger bath would have been nice!! Courteous, friendly staff. Would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: remlucs
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed in Venice before so we needed to make a judgement about the location and quality of hotel from the websites. The pictures showed exactly what the hotel was like. We were dropped off by a water taxi very close to the hotel and the surrounding areas were absolutely exquisite. As a first timer to venice, the location was perfect and the service, quality of rooms, cleanliness etc. was exactly what we would expect from a four star hotel. We went to Venice as a party of four and all of us felt the hotel was lovely. It would suit individuals and couples (both mature and young). We would stay in this hotel should we visit Venice again and I would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Ca' dei Conti - would go back in a second!!”
Reviews.Author: kkimColorado
Reviews.Content: We booked directly through the hotel and let them know it was our anniversary! We had a wonderful room on the top floor, the room and the bathroom were both very large! The staff was great! The views were nice (rooftops and a small canal). Breakfast was very nice and the room it was served in was beautiful!! The location was superb and the price (for Venice) was great too! If we ever go back to Venice we will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book the right room”
Reviews.Author: TomKat_17
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a fantastic location but I would agree with the last reviewer by saying be careful when booking your room. We stayed for a long weekend in July and were given a room across the street from the hotel which really was absolutely awful. It was like a basic chalet, with cheap plastic decor that had absolutely no links whatsoever to the fine venetian furnishings indicated in the hotels own review. After complaining (and unfortunately succumbing to parting with more money) we were moved to a room within the main hotel which made the world of difference. It had lovely wooden beams and glorious ventian style fabrics and paintings. If we had been given this room in the first place, I would certainly have rated the hotel as a 4-star. The location was fabulous. Very close to all the sights, yet away from it all when you felt like some peace and quiet. Overall, our lovely replacement room saved the day and it really was an enjoyable holiday. However after first-hand experience of what the hotel was prepared to offer us and taking on board the opinions of others who have experienced the same, I would question the integrity of a hotel whose own standards appear to vary to such a large degree, purely in order to make a profit. If the owners are reading - update those rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the room across the street!”
Reviews.Author: klncpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca dei Conti for four nights the first week of October. BEWARE of the room(s) across the street from the hotel. We were given a room in the building across the street (appears to be an apartment or condo building as locals were entering the building as well). In stark contrast to the 18th century charm that the hotel advertises, this room has all the charm of a mid 1980's college dormitory room...complete with a hole in the wall, 13 inch tv, tacky furniture, and kitchenette with no plates or silverware. When we were there, the phone didn't work, but I'm not sure what good it would have done us if it had, since there was no keypad on which to dial (even to dial the reception desk). There was no safe deposit box, but they brought us one...but what good is a safe deposit box that someone can walk off with (especially when the keys to the room are missing...we turned them in at the desk when we left but the staff couldn't find them when we returned). After expressing our displeasure, we were told that they were fully booked and a move was not possible. After being told that, while waiting in the lobby to report yet another problem we'd discovered, I was shocked to see three couples checking in, one of which asked to see available rooms and was shown them. After they returned to report which one they had selected, I demanded that we be put in the one that they had rejected. I was initially told no, but after reciting the problems with the room we were in before a lobby full of guests checking in (in particular the phone that didn't work and the mobile safe deposit box), the manager was called and we were moved. The room that we ended up with was very charming. The breakfast is a good continental breakfast. Once we got out of the hell hole across the street, we had a very nice stay at the Ca dei Conti. We'd probably stay there again, but only with the assurance that we'd be in a room in the hotel, not the building across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMaritimer
Reviews.Content: The location was great, very close to San Marco piazza, which was an excellent place to spend an evening. The owners were friendly, the rooms were clean, and the price was good (for Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: mpbbarrett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in a busy September time. It was quiet and quaint and the hotel staff was very friendly. We first got taken to a room across the bridge from the main hotel (1st floor) that seemed more like a dorm room than a hotel room. We asked to be changed into the main hotel and they showed us two rooms to look at. The first one was the size of a box but the second one was great. The location is great once you get your bearings in Venice. I would stay here again. Don't get room 107 though as it is literally in the breakfast area. We were on the second floor in a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fritzvtb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, even a bit posh to say the least. The location is great. Just get on vaporretta 1 heading towards San Marco and get off on the San Zarrichi stop. Then reference the map on the hotel website. It looks bad, but it is really a simple walk. The rule of thumb for the walk from the vaporretta stop to the hotel is this: the only bridge you will cross is the one at the hotel front door. If you walk over a bridge, then you are going in the wrong direction. The breakfast could have been better, would have loved to have eggs of any kind (hard-boiled even). But overall, a nice hotel to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rossies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ca' Dei Conti 2 nights (4&5 September 2007) - were given an apartment literally over the small bridge from the hotel - very cool and spacious. Breakfast was fine, in main hotel. Location is very good - 5 minutes walk to St Mark's square. After leaving hotel to go on to Garda we found our credit card was missing - checked with hotel & it was not there. We advised them we had last used it in a restuarant off St Mark's and they offered to contact them and see if it was there - it was, fortunately!! Although we had to return to Venice to collect it we were very grateful to hotel staff for being so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two very disappointing nights at this hotel last month (August 2007). First, certain of the staff and management were rude and unaccommodating. Second, those attending the front desk were, at best, inexperienced and unapologetic. We missed the gondola ride promised to us by the hotel because we were told to wait in the lobby of the hotel by one person attending the desk and then when the appointed time had come and gone another person attending the desk told us we were supposed to have been ten blocks away at the port. When we informed the front desk the next morning that we had not received anything promised to us by the hotel, namely the gondola ride, the tour of the glass factory and the bottle of prosecco, we were told it was our fault and that we were still being charged for those items. Third, as with other European hotels, two twin beds were pushed together to create a very uncomfortable double bed. And last but not least, there were stains on the sheets. At no point did we, as English speaking Americans, feel welcome at this hotel. We also did not feel that we received the service and accommodations for which we had paid. We have stayed at hotels around the world and this one ranks at the very bottom. I would strongly consider other Venice options before deciding to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Doliver
Reviews.Content: Ca Dei Conti is a fabulous small botique hotel that sits on a small canal just a few steps from St Marks or the Rialto Bridge. It is in a quiet location yet close to everything. We were upgraded to a suite that had a seperate living and bed room. It was #202 FABULOUS. Our travel mates were also upgraded to a jr suite #201 which was very nice and spacious, The rooms are beautiful, very Venitian with fabric wall coverings and wonderful linens. The bathrooms are very nice, clean, good shower head and bidet. The breakfast which is included is very good and presented nicely. The staff is well trained, friendly, professional. By the 2nd day they know you name and room number. Paul was the "best" really nice young man who couldn't do enought to make your stay just right. The location is perfect, just far enough from St Marks to be quiet, however just a 5 min walk. Took a private water taxi from/to the airport which in my opinion is the only way to go. Yes it is more money (about 90 EUR for up to 6 people) however I have done the Vaporato and beleive me, the water taxi is worth every penny. The Vaporato is great for getting around once you are in Venice, but spend the money and do the private taxi for the aiport. IMPORTANT HINT: Buy your Dige Palace tickets at the hotel. They are cheaper and let you go directly to the entrance and avoid the long lines. Ofcourse, don't forget to strool in the evenings and listen to the music in St Marks Square, it's just Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Central yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: DevonEmma
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights here with my family; me, my husband, my mother (77) 2 sons (17) 1 daughter (16) 1 neice (16). We had a fabulous time. We had two double rooms & two twin rooms for the seven of us. It is no distance from both St Marks and San Zaccaria yet is completely quiet. The rooms were all comfortable with air conditioning, safes, mini bars (children were forbidden to touch these) satellite tv and masses of storage. My mother's room even had a sofa & 2 armchairs should she have felt like a party. The staff all spoke embarisingly good English though we did try to speak Italian. The breakfasts were enormous; bread, biscuits, croissants, cakes, fruit - fresh & salad, cereal (4 kinds), excellent coffee, yoghurt, ham, salami, cheese etc etc. Tea, of course, was bags and 'hot' water...but this is Italy! The only thing to be aware of is that the hotel is in 2 (connected) buildings. Our rooms were in the 'other' half and the breakfast room was very small. But only one of us had to wait for a place on one day. The 'main' hotel has a much larger breakfast room on the first floor with the same breakfast but an airier room. My mother and one son both breakfasted here one day. Also, there is a very pretty roof terrace on the 'main' building. If you didn't go looking for it you wouldn't know it was there. One final warning, both breakfast rooms appeared to have bedrooms opening straight on to them. I was glad not to have had one of those. The reception staff were very helpful when I asked for help with booking a restaurant one night and also booking a water taxi to the airport. While waiting in the lobby one evening a couple with 3 children walked in, not guests, and demanded a huge amount of information on the way to another hotel with not even a please or thank you and the staff dealt with them very politely and took time to help them. Though we had to check out by 12am there was a room to store all our luggage and a porter took it all to meet the taxi for us at 6.30 that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: p0key
Reviews.Content: Ca' Dei Conti is located 5 minutes from San Marco square, so it is easy to get to almost all of the major sites in Venice. The room we had was sparsely decorated, but huge. A "standard" room included a kitchenette and loads of space. The staff is especially helpful. They provided an excellent restaurant recommendation, help with storing bags before and after our stay, and got us a free ride out to Murano to see the glass factory. Excellent hotel and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gem”
Reviews.Author: Alizz1
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is wonderfully situated in the Castello area of Venice. It is a small hotel on a canal (not passed by gondolas) and well within reach of all the sites. Venice is a beautiful place and this hotel is ideal. The only problems we had were they were deorating and we could smell paint at first. This meant the breakfast room was out of action but we had room service every morning with a great selection. The rooms are small but clean and the staff are friendly. Would definately stay again. The Venetian's are friendly and this was a good time to visit. Try a gondola they're fantastic. We made sure ours was in traditional dress and despite not much english it was great. (some wear jeans and use mobile phones all the way round, doesn't help the romance!)

Reviews.Title: “don't take room 107 (off the breakfast room)”
Reviews.Author: Blade77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well positioned giving you the option to get off vaporettas at San Zaccharia or St Marks. (Tip: get the aligunia airport boat from S. Marco as its the first stop and you can get a good seat before everyone else piles on at San Zacchaira). The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly, helpfully they mostly spoke good english. Our room was massive, a really luxury, but a bit noisy. The breakfast diners weren't really heard but the staff could be heard in the kitchen at times and the air conditioning unit for the breakfast room was right outside our door. The room also has two further locked window/doors that lead onto a corridor. These let a bit of light through despite the curtains and also were near noisy machines that kept be awake for a while one night. I couldn't figure out from what reception said if they were washing machines, I assume they were. typically british we put up with it and didn't ask to be moved, because it didn't seem severe enough to complain and also the most noise was on our last night. The two star rating on this website is a nonsense. Every website you can book this on puts it down as a 4*. Don't think that you might get a two star room or service because its definately 4 *.

Reviews.Title: “Love our hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: soojones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca dei Conti Venice in April 2007 for my birthday and wedding anniversary. The front desk staff are OK and very accomodating...only one acts like he was depresssed most of the time, a little downer for us. =) We went with 2 other couples but our friends stayed in the other hotels, WESTIN REGINA and a bed and breakfast place. Ca dei Conti was a bit difficult to find for a first timer...( please give better direction ) but when you do find it, it is really nice. A local helped us...and in return, we helped 2 other couples who were lost searching for their hotels when we were there. Ca dei Conti, the lobby may not look as fancy as Westin Regina..(psst...our room is nicer than the one there!) but we love our room!! They surprised us with a bottle of champagne in our room too! Hotels are all pretty easy to find after a day there...Love finding our way around. Nothing to be worried about. Our room was amazingly beautiful, great view of the canals down below...you hear the men working with their gondolas singing in the mornings, a cute fat cat enjoying the sun with flowers everywhere, opposite our buidling...overall a very quiet place compared to the hotels out front of San Marco square and less crowded too, thank god. Yes, the bathroom was beautiful.........and super clean! Price is definitely the most expensive of this vacation....but worth every penny. Breakfast is yummy, very important for my husband. =) Highly recommended. Oh yes, we love having our own boat, compliments of our hotels ( Westin and Cadei Conti) to take us to the Murano islands, of course.. to buy Murano chandelier and vases! Our friends had a super noisy and overly crowded area in San Marco, more like a 1star hotel instead of 3. They wished they had booked a better hotel. Only bad experience we had was with the RUDE TAXI men when we first arrived. We took the water taxi for much cheaper and had no problems travelling anywhere...Just keep your eyes open and your hands tight on your bags, you will be fine! Overall...we love Italy! Enjoy your vacation.....romantic, honeymoon or with friends and family! SooJones

Reviews.Title: “Like the other reviewers, we also loved the Ca dei Conti”
Reviews.Author: greymanu
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Venice for my birthday earlier this year. I had never been before but had been longing to forever - I was not disappointed. The Ca dei Conti was such a wonderful, charming little hotel, I thoroughly recommend it. As others have posted, it is on a small canal very close to the main action but back far enough to be peaceful. Print off a copy of the hotel's instructions and you should find it easily enough. Our room (which was off the reading lounge) was huge, beautifully appointed and very quiet. The continental breakfast was varied and very good for Europe, though the tea was terrible but then it always is on the Continent (why do I not learn and take my own tea bags with me?!) January was a wonderful time to visit Venice, we avoided most of the Venetian summer pitfalls (crowds, heat/humidity, mosquitoes, stinky canals) and got a very good price on the hotel room. The evening mist also had its own romantic charms. I didn't find it particularly cold, no more so than London, and one could wander all day and not get overheated. There was an excellent chicheti bar (not sure if I spelt that correctly, basically the Venetian version of tapas) near to the hotel. I can't remember the name of it but it is on the corner of Campo di San Filippo and Callo Drio la Chesa. It has a modern interior. The chicheti and wine are fabulous, but sit at the counter, not the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, yes, but...”
Reviews.Author: Pennyiom
Reviews.Content: ...slightly disappointing. Have just returned from a 3 day break at this hotel, having previously spent hours researching the best hotel. Although tricky to find (only managed to find it without a map on our last day!) it's in a pretty, quiet canal near San Marco and is certainly beautifully decorated. However, on our arrival my husband and I were shown to the smallest boxroom I've ever seen, with a small double bed and a wardrobe (no other furniture). It was so small that the bell boy couldn't actually get in the room with us! We asked for another room and were immediately shown to an attic room, which was bigger and had lovely furnishings with a luxurious marble bathroom and a big double bed (which was very comfortable). Then we discovered that there was no Bar in the Hotel, despite the hotel information sheet in the room saying the bar was open from 5pm - 11pm and our minibar didn't work, so everything in it was warm. We asked for it to be fixed but to no avail. There were 2 other English couples staying at the same time as us and both were not entirely happy with the hotel - airconditioning didn't work, couldn't get a drink, breakfast room very cramped etc. Although we had a pleasant stay - Venice is absolutely magical - we wouldn't stay here again because, in our opinion for Â£180 a night it was a luxurious Bed and Breakfast and certainly not a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thourougly enjoyed the stay here”
Reviews.Author: LauraBLancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of march for 4 nights. It took a while to find the hotel but once we did it was fine. The location could not be better. its pretty much central to everything. The hotel is lovely inside and our room was spacious and had everything we needed. The breakfast was included this was quite simple (no hot food) but was fine. Word of warning be careful when going out for meals as they tend to add a lot of money onto the bills for various things and dont drink to much. We got charged just under Â£5 for a can of coke. Overall the hotel was brilliant would deffinately stay there again. its beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Our First Trip to Venice...”
Reviews.Author: devilcat
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for my wife's birthday and it was the best holiday of our lives (with the exception of our wedding, obviously). Venice is a friendly city, although punishing on the legs and feet if you are not used to walking...but we didn't feel unsafe or nervous of the surroundings once, even while wandering about after 10:00pm looking for something to eat. The hotel was surprisingly easy to find, although this was down to the instructions on their own website and not our 'natural navigation' skills. We would highly recommend getting off the Alilaguna Water Bus at San Zacharia if possible as the San Marco stop, although the next closest, is just that bit further to walk with your luggage (and with the bridges you will want to take the shortest route). On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a warm and friendly reception - and the staff's English was impeccable in comparison to our Italian! The room was spacious and comfortable - we were on the third floor / attic room and it was lovely! The amenities in the hotel are slightly less than expected - I had read there was a bar, which is true, but it is seldom manned and it does not really offer a lot - but with Venice literally 1 - 2 minutes away - who cares about a drink in the Hotel? The breakfast is continental - and you will be silly not to try Everything! The Croissants are stunning - the meat and cheeses are excellent and the biscuits they make are to die for!!! If you're a tea drinker you will need to ask one of the waitresses for this as they traditionally serve coffee. The staff were also exceptionally helpful in assisting me by arranging for a guide to take us to a complementary Private Water Taxi pick-up point and organising a trip over to the Munaro Glass making factory. The trip was excellent but the 'sales-man' who showed us around got a bit full on with the sales bit - until my wife kindly pointed out we were just looking today - at which point he asked to show us the exit...My suggestion with this experience is to go in the knowledge they will try to sell you the glass - enjoy the free demonstrations and then expect the sales push resulting in a swift end to the tour if you decline the offer to purchase... In addition to the complimentary tour of Munaro - the staff helped me arrange some surprise flowers in the room for my wife on her birthday - this was a lovely touch and I am glad they did the ordering, otherwise who knows what we would have ended up having delivered... There are always things that could make your trip easier...a man-servant to carry the luggage - a travelator to reduce the walking - even a personal shopper while looking for presents - but in all honesty - Venice is a place you will WANT to walk around - shop in and even experience taking your luggage to and from the hotel...it is a one off holiday and the Ca Dei Conti was an excellently located hotel for us to do it from.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: barrycrompton
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a city, what a hotel. We were so lucky to be given a suite to stay in, it was like something out of a fairy tale. The hotel is within walking distance of St Mark's Square, good breakfast, very clean, beautiful decor, definitely worth the money. Even though a gondola ride is expensive, it is worth every penny. You can negotiate the price with the gondolia, but we paid 80 Euro and we had everything, a great history of Venice and he sang to us as we went under the Rialto Bridge. Amazing!! Take plenty of money with you though, Venice is very, very, expensive, and it is difficult to do anything on the cheap. But if you want to go to the most romantic city in the world, don't let anything put you off, it is well worth a visit at least once in a life time!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesDaisy
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 night stay in this hotel March 07 and it turned out to be fabulous. Close to St Mark's, which is a big consideration when you travel on the water bus there and you have luggage, and easy to find. Hotel is next to a small canal, in a quiet location. On arrival, we were upgraded to a suite with no explanation (which was nice) and it was a superb room, very large, perfect bathroom with jacuzzi bath and bed upstairs. The room was off the dining room but no noise at all from there. Room cleaned twice a day, reception as helpful as you like, breakfast in the room (too lazy to walk thru' the door!), altho we had to pay for that it was worth it. Only complaint was the bed was hard, but some people like that and we had a settee downstairs which pulled out into sofa bed and that was softer. Highly recommended. As good as it gets actually - in this price range, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: traveller025
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March. Had booked standard double room via ---.com for Â£264 for 2 people for 3 nights inc breakfast. A real bargain compared to other websites including hotels own. We were upgraded to a suite free of charge on arrival for no apparent reason. 2 massive rooms beautifully decorated. Slightly disappointed at tiny bathroom with only shower but no bath but didn't feel we could complain! The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was serviced twice a day. Breakfast was fine although dining room very small. We took a water taxi from airport to hotel which although expensive (90 euros) is a must. Took the water bus back- much cheaper 12 euros each but slower 1hr 10mins. Hotel within 5 mins walk from St Marks Square. Book for the secret itineries tour in Doges palace- amazing. Beware the free trip to glass blowing factory offered by hotel. Free water taxi there but hard sell in factory then shown the back door when obvious we weren't going to buy. No free water taxi back- the water bus service is fine tho. Funny experience! Fab hotel, fab city. Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Really good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: candidreview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this little hotel, right in the center of Venice, only a short walk from San Marco Square during the Carnival season for $200 a night. This hotel is very clean, and rooms are nice except for the single room I saw on top floor which I didn't like too much. The only downside I can think of is that most rooms have no view - which is common in Venice. However, most rooms are nice and quite elaborate in typical Italian flavor. The two-star status is confusing as the hotel seem to deserve much better. I stayed at the Locanda Leon Bianco last time that touts itself to be 3-star and there is no comparisment at all (Locanda Leon Bianco is a dump compared to this hotel and offers much of nothing for the money and is very noisy). I had all luxuries, except room service. Including a flat panel TV in my room and a small bar. My bathroom was in pink marble with a towelheater. When I returned to my room in the evening, they had prepare the bed! The only hotel that has given me that service before was the Beverly Hills Hotel, so I had no complaints. Total worth the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfbDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel for those who have a little extra cash to spend on a room. It is hidden away down a number of alleyways about a five minute walk from St Marks. It can be found easily with a little help from the locals. Our room was huge. It had a mezzanine which comprised a beautiful double bed and sumptious furniture. There was also a flat screen TV. downstairs was also spacious with mini bar, tv, writing tables, additional sofa/bed and a jacozzi bath!. We were in a room leading onto the breakfast room but didnt find it in any way inconvenient. In fact it was nice to open your door and have your breakfast ready and waiting for you. Plenty to eat from the buffet with juices, cereals, fruit, breads, cakes, yogurts, meats etc. The location is superb and central to everything. The staff were extremely friendly and considerate. No pressure checking out and breakfast served until 10.30am.If you fly ryanair take the ryanair bus to Plz Roma. ( 5 euro)Then take the Vaporetta 82 or 1 to San Marco or Zacarria. Hotel is literally a 5 minute stroll away. Venice is wonderful for a couple of days and the best way to see it is to take the Vaperetto No 1 which meanders around the Grand Canal. Check out the Inishark Irish Pub which is only two minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a great location, perhaps a little overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: priceypop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Venice late on a Thursday evening and given that I had not properly printed the directions we found Ca' Dei Conti very easily (with a little help from the locals). The hotel is in a great location near to St Marks Square and nestled among some of the great Bacari's in Venice. This is a quaint little place full of character, however, if you are execting a comfortable bed at the end of a long day in Venice this may not be the place for you. Even to look at the bed seemed uncomfortable and we were right, was like sleeping on a board. The only other disapointing aspect was the breakfast, whilst the food was very tasty it is continential only, no hot food. Overall this was a charming little hotel in a great location but would probably choose somewhere else if we were to return to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the most wonderful Christmas break. We booked to stay at the Ca Dei Conti after reading some reviews on here, and thought it looked good, so decided to book. What a good move that was. By the way I booked through lastminute.com and got 78% off the standard price so have a look there befor you book. Upon our arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the very friendly staff and the check-in process was very quick. We were shown to our rooms, we had 103, our friend had 307. The rooms were both very nice, although we did think 307 was a little small. Our room overlooked the canal and as such got the occasional smell from the canal, but to be fair it does not matter where you are in Venice, there is always an underlying smell in the air. Our bed was very comfortable and we had an excellent nights sleep and we were pleased to have air con/heating as it was a little chilly at night and you can set the temp by the side of the bed. The minibar is pretty cheap and we also took advantage of the laundry service to press our clothes which was very cheap. The breakfast was excellent, a good choice of cereals, muesli, fruit, yoghurt, croissants, cold meats, cheeses, and more. You can also have eggs and bacon if you want and you can have your breakfast delivered to your room. We did notice that there were a few rooms that lead directly into both the breakfast rooms and I don't think I would like to stay in one of those rooms as I expect it may be a bit noisy. While we were there we asked to view a suite because there were none available when we had booked, but I did not think the one I saw was worth the extra cost as the classic double we had was much nicer. The directions to the hotel suggested we get the vaporetto to San Zaccharia and head through the streets to find the hotel, but after being there a few days, we realised that it is quicker to get off at Rialto and walk as it is the same distance and means you can get to the hotel quicker to drop off your luggage. We did not mind the cruise along the grand canal though as the weather was so lovely. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice boutique hotel in easy walking distance to everyting venice has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: r10t3r
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel which I booked via lastminute.com - having just returned this week following a brilliant 3 night stay I must recommend it. For value, location and quality of accomodation I cannot compliment it enough. It is located literally 2 minutes from St. Marks square in a peaceful typical venetian sidestreet with a private bridge that opens up into a fabulous marble reception hall - i was honestly taken aback. Me and my partner then had our cases whisked away to our room by the porter whilst the receptionist promptly checked us in and ensured the room was to our satisfaction. The hotel is decorated fabulously, and there are large pieces of luxury furnishings throughout - our room was large, bright and whilst fitted with modern amenities retained its classical charm. I booked the hotel having assessed many reviews on this website - and hope to dispel any myths regarding this destination. Firstly Venice is a maze and it will take you a while to get your bearings - take down the address and map of the hotel and take the time during your flight (or before) to have a rough idea where you are going. The water bus stop at Zacharria is literally 2-3 streets away from the hotel, San Marco not much further. This hotel is not difficult to find - but you cannot simply walk into the streets of venice and know where you are going instantly - it's a totally different experience! I noticed a couple of mentions of a room that opens into the breakfast room - this exists and personally i wouldn't want it. Hold on before you make your judgement. There is also a room that opens literally into reception near to the entrance - these rooms are not any less luxurious, but perhaps privacy would be an issue. Initially we were offered this particular room - I said no - the hotel said no problem and moved us with no hassle at all to an equally stunning, and much more private room, on the 4th floor. Just remember you are the customer and don't be afraid to politely ask to be moved - the helpful gentleman on reception wasn't bothered at all...though I'm sure the porter might have objected moving our bags again :-D Breakfast is a buffet style - a selection of cheeses and hams, cereals, warmed croissants and breads were readily available. Fresh coffee, juices and tea is the perfectly adequate choice for drinks! If I recall correctly, they serve relentlessly from 7am until 10:30am, leaving plenty of time following perhaps a little too much vino the night before. Overall this is a fantastic place to stay - lots of character - superb location - its absolutely perfect. You are close to the shops, a choice of bars & restaurants as well as feet away from St Marks - you will be laughing once you are out and about. Rialto bridge is about a 10 minute picturesque walk. Our rooms were cleaned at least twice each day and the hotel is spotless - stay here, enjoy it, and enjoy Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: auroa
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this hotel in March 06 for my birthday and i couldnt reccommmend a better hotel than the Ca Dei Conti. This hotel is magnificent and the service was fantastic, every time we left the room the maids would tidy up after us, replace dirty towels, empty bins ect. Every night when we got back to the hotel after a lovely night out the bed would be folded and the bedlight would be on. The breakfast is lovely with crossiants, salami,cheeses, yogurts and cereals... A diet is needed after a trip here. The location is fantastic just 2mins walk from St Marks square and 10min walk to the Grand Canal. This hotel and city is truly magical, the trip was extra special to us as we got engaged here on my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended”
Reviews.Author: tonybrazier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked here during the last week in October 2006 for a total of 4 nights and were very happy, well looked after and would definitely book again. Our room was first class. The hotel was excellent value, the breakfast buffet was unlimited and varied and the service could not be bettered. The situation for a tourist could not be more convenient as it is so central and most sites can be walked to within minutes. When transport is required the Grand Canal is 5 minutes away. As the hotel has no restaurant it is necessary to eat out (no bad thing when visiting a new city) and the recommendations of the concierge can be trusted. We followed their advice and were very happy indeed. It helps to allow them to book the restaurants, as they managed to get us in at our preferred time, when we could not. Tony Brazier

Reviews.Title: “Luxuriously Romantic”
Reviews.Author: MissyTLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in Jan. A good location and a charming hotel - especially if you have a suite. Our stay is somewhat more special as we got engaged during our stay - truly a magical experience. We recommend the suite for those hoping for a special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, atmospheric hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChocBrownie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good, but perhaps not quite as good as the money we paid might have suggested. Quite a confusing location (although Venice is generally very easy to get lost in - a map is essential!!) but we found it okay if you follow the directions on their website. Lovely little private bridge over a canal to get to the entrance. All done out in a very ornate, Venetian style. Our room was small but it felt quite special, with lots of gold, rich fabrics and chandelier style light fittings. There was no bath in the bathroom, but a very good shower. No view over the canal either, so it is worth requesting this if it is important to you. But nice and quiet and the turn-down service at night was a nice touch. We also enjoyed using the lovely terrace which was a shady godsend from the heat and the bustle of the city. Overall a good experience, but I'd say that we had bigger and better hotels for less money on our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at Ca dei Conti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked what we thought was a four star hotel in Venice, the Ca dei Conti. My room, although adequate, was small, and there was no place but the floor to put our suitcases. My firends were put in an attic room, which could be reached only by a steep staircase, and the lack of a formal room number indicated it was probably an illegal room. It was iincredibly small with slanted roof and no place for suitcases except on the floor. The bathroom fixtures were so close that one had to sidle their way to the toilet, just barely enough room for your knees to clear the bidet opposite. Air conditioning did not work, the room was terribly hot, and opening the window invited hordes of mosqitoes in. At midnight my firend went to complain to the concierge, who was very cavalier, one might say rude, about the situation -- sayng there was no other room (even though we had booked months in advance), and eventually stating that a better room would cost them an additional 40 euros per night. A word of warning: in reading other reviews of this hotel, I see that ours was not a unique situation. Unfortunately, we learned this too late. We paid for a four star hotel! What a joke. I do have photos that show how bad this room really was and, I understand, other rooms in the hotel have problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate most of the reviews on this site so far. This Hotel is a great find and we've just had 3 wonderful nights there. It's pretty and it's so quiet considering that it's so close to San Marco. We stayed in a beamed attic room which couldn't have been better (ask for Rm 405!!). Really, this should be a 5 star. It's worth getting a taxi from here to the airport (Euro 85), if only for the thrill of the ride!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 3rd April. It is only 5 minutes from San Marco or the Rialto Bridge. We found it difficult to find as we arrived at Midnight and could only see the map in the light from the shop windows! But the next day in daylight it was easy. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was lovely served in the beatiful dining room. There was lots of choice from juices, hot drinks, cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, yogurts, fruit and croissants. We stayed in room 105 which is on the ground floor. To get to it you had to leave the hotel at the rear, cross an alley and enter another building by our own key. We had our own entrance area shared with one other room. Room 105 was lovely. Decorated in Gold and Creams. The curtains, bedding and padded wall coverings were beautiful, there was lots of cupboards and wardrobes and everywhere was very clean. We had a television but the only channel that was in english was CNN. This did not matter as we did not have time to watch TV anyway! There was an extra small room just off the main bedroom which had a chair, wardrobes, another TV and minibar in it. We stored our cases in here.The bathroom had a whirpool bath and a shower attachment. The only complaint we had was that the shower tended to leak onto the bathroom floor and that the room was too cold. There was no heating and with the ceramic tiles on the floor, you had to keep your shoes on when walking around. When we asked about the heating/air conditioning, we were told they were not allowed to put it on until May! Unfortunately when we were in Venice at this time, the weather was cold wet and windy! Upstairs in the main part of the hotel you could sit and relax in a lovely lounge complete with a painted ceiling and just off this lounge was a lovely roof terrace where you could sit in the sun. (Unfortunately there was not much sun for us!) This hotel was a brilliant place to stay for our 1st visit to Venice and I would definitely stay here again. Perhaps when the weather was warmer!
